loans.name: Tanweer

texts.en:
Ms. Tanweer is a 23-year-old married woman and the mother of two sons. Her eldest son is standing next to Tanweer in the photo. Five years ago she started a general store to support her family. She offers various goods for everyday use. She has a good client list and serves well in her community. Her husband is a salesperson at a garment shop and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Both her children are going to school but her eldest son helps her in his free time.  

Ms. Tanweer wants to grow her business and she requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase stock of sugar, cooking oil and rice in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She wishes to use part of her revenue to deal with her children’s education expenses and to increase their business capital.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: Jean D'amour

texts.en:
Jean D'Amour is 31 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have two young children. 

Jean D'Amour has been a maize farmer for 15 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines, like tractors, that will enhance his farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at the previous maize plantation. Jean D'Amour says that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is married with four children. She tells us that she has operated a mat weaving business in her home for 1 year. It is well stocked. She is a very hardworking person, eager to succeed and help her family, as she knows that life is hard, and working is the only way to get ahead.

Sidi is applying for the loan in order to buy supplies that she wishes use to weave mats to supply her business with, and to continue providing good products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to weave mats to supply her business

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 48 años que vive en la parroquia de "Pastocalle" en el cantón "Latacunga" ubicado en la región Andina del Ecuador.  Latacunga se caracteriza por ser muy acogedora, que con su catedral y la Iglesia de San Francisco muestra la belleza del arte religioso, ambientadas con estrechas calles adoquinadas, resaltadas por los vivos colores de las típicas fachadas de sus viviendas y el polvoriento paisaje circundante. Latacunga viene de dos voces quichuas llacata kunka que significa Dios de las Lagunas. Cuando llega noviembre sus empedradas calles se llenan de alegría por la celebración de la fiesta en honor a la Virgen de las Mercedes, se trata de la ceremonia de la “Mama Negra” , que simboliza la fertilidad y la productividad de la tierra.

María está casada con Luis, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 8, 11, 12, y 18 años. Ella para aportar a la economía del hogar fabrica escobas, actividad que la aprendió de sus padres. Trabaja 8 horas al día y no recibe ayuda. María comenta que su gran obstáculo siempre ha sido no haber continuado con sus estudios ya que únicamente terminó la primaria y luego el no poder acceder fácilmente a fuentes de financiamiento haciendo que el crecer de su negocio sea muy complicado. María desea fortalecer su negocio por lo que requiere un préstamo con el cual comprará materia prima y podrá hacer un buen lote de su producto. Con esta inversión espera tener mejores ingresos con lo que podrá dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Su gran sueño es ver a sus hijos con educación completa y con profesiones dignas que contribuyan al crecimiento del país, esta emprendedora se esfuerza cada día por lograrlo.
texts.en:
María is 48 and lives in Pastocalle parish, Latacunga canton, located in Ecuador's Andean region. Latacunga is a welcoming city. Its cathedral and the Church of San Francisco exemplify the beauty of religious art, and its cobblestone streets are lined with the brightly colored facades of traditional homes that stand out in the dusty environment. Latacunga comes from the Quichua words "llacata kunka" that mean "God of the Lakes". In November, the paved streets are filled with people celebrating the joyous feast honoring the Virgen de las Mercedes during the ceremony of Mama Negra, who symbolizes the fertility of the land. 

María is married to Luis, with whom she has 4 children, ages 8, 11, 12, and 18. To help support her household, she makes brooms, work she learned from her parents. She works 8 hours a day without help. She says her greatest obstacle has always been not being able to continue her education. She only finished elementary school. She has not had easy access to financing, which has complicated the growth of her business. María wants to strengthen her business, which requires receiving a loan to buy commodities to make a large batch of her product. She expects to generate better income with the investment and give her children a better life.

María's greatest dream is to see her children complete their education and have decent careers through which they will contribute to the country's growth. She works hard every day to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy commodities and strengthen her business.

loans.name: Unidas Para Vencer Group

texts.es: Doña Ada tiene 43 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Unidas para Vencer, es casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo es comerciante, ellos residen en la comunidad de San Nicolás, de la ciudad de Juticalpa, Departamento de Olancho. Doña Ada se dedica a la venta de verduras, frutas y golosinas, desde hace algunos años se dedica a esta actividad y le ha resultado muy rentable, trabaja en conjunto con su esposo, su horario de atención es de 6:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm. La ventaja es que tiene muchos clientes y el negocio le deja ganancias para cubrir sus gastos. El préstamo que doña Ada esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá tener mejor surtido su negocio. Su meta es lograr tener un negocio más grande, bien surtido y obtener un local más amplio. Doña Ada es cliente de FAMA desde hace 10 ciclos y hasta la actualidad ha sido puntual con sus cuotas de pagos.
texts.en: Ada is 43 years old. She is a member of the group "Solidario Unidas para Vencer" (United Together to Overcome). She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is in business. They live in the community of San Nicolás in the city of Juticalpa, department of Olancho. Ada works selling vegetables, fruits, and candies and she has been doing this for some years and it has turned out to be very profitable. She works alongside her husband. She works from 6:00am until 6:00pm. The advantage is that she has many customers and the business gives her a profit to cover her expenses. Ada needs the loan that she is requesting to buy fruits and vegetables. With the help of this loan, she will be able to better supply her business. Her goals is to have a bigger business that is well supplied and in a larger space. Ada has been a member of FAMA for 10 loan cycles and, to date, has been punctual in making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is 24 years old. She is single. She has been a farmer for the past 4 years. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines, like tractors, that will enhance her farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at the previous maize plantation. Marie Grace says that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en: Milkah is a married woman. She has two children, ages 8 and 11 years old. She describes herself as a determined woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells scrap metal. Her business is located at a ready market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase scrap metal for restocking her business. Her goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes to build rental houses to increase her business income in the future.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 26-year-old single man who has been working in a business of manufacturing plastic bags and papers for four years. He is a hardworking man. Through his previous loan he increased his raw materials, which improved and developed his business a lot and increased his income, in addition to expanding his working zone.

Nader is applying again for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay for his wedding fees. He believes that Al Majmoua loans are worth applying for because they provide you with a good increase in income and business expansion. Nader is the only person in his region with such a business, and he is insistent upon being the leader. He is planning to expand it as much as he can.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding fees.

loans.name: Thacien

texts.en:
Thacien is age 27. He is married to a farmer and they have one child. Thacien has been a maize farmer for 8 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at his previous maize plantation and he says that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a 39-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be hardworking. Evans operates a grocery store where he sells items such as onions, kale, tomatoes, carrots, bananas, etc.. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located at a potential business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Evans will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy clothes for starting a new business of selling clothes. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a land for his family. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes for starting a new business of selling clothes

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is a widow, age 44. She has been a farmer for the past 12 years. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines, like tractors, that will enhance her farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at the previous maize plantation. Evelyne says that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Carmen Jeanette

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 33 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por la orilla de una playa cercana a su hogar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, Carmen puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella cuenta con un pequeño espacio en su casa donde realiza sus ventas, Carmen puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Carmen se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kivas, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, menestras, bebidos, entre otros; de esta manera Carmen tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, así ella espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 33 year old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Camaná. She is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to overcome. In her free moments, she likes to to walk on the shore of a beach close to her home and sometimes to cook a delicious Arroz Chaufa de Pollo (Peruvian-Chinese fried rice) to share with her family. 
With much determination, enthusiasm, and and thanks to help from her parents, Carmen opened her little grocery store. Everyday, she starts work in the early hours. She has a small space in her house where she makes her sales. She works about 12 hours a day and believes that she is doing well because of her dedication and the kind way that she treats her customers.
Carmen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they have offered, she will be able to buy merchandise for her store such as: rice, sugar, oil, milk, legumes, drinks, and other things. In this way, Carmen will have a better supplied store which she hopes will increase her sales and her income which will help her to grow her store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: The United Group

texts.en:
Amidu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Amidu was born in Tonkolili, in Northern Sierra Leone. He is 36 years of age. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has 1 child, attending primary school. For 19 years now, Amidu has been selling stationery.  

Amidu and his group members have applied for a loan of 800,000 SLL for each in the group to enable them expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Amidu will use his share of the loan (800,000 SLL) to expand his business by buying a wide variety of stationery to add to his business. 
 
(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of stationery to add to his business

loans.name: Haydalina

texts.es: Haydalina de 48 anos de edad, casada con tres hijos mayores de edad de la localidad del sauce lugar que esta ubicado en la parte norte del país, Sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, es una zona muy ganadera, la crianza de cerdos para venta y elaboración de comidas típicas del cerdo como: el chancho con yuca, adobado, frito. Ella tiene por actividad económica la crianza de cerdo, tiene  7 anos de tener dicha actividad. En la actualidad ha presentado desafíos y problemas, como es la venta bajas ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario para invertir en la compra de centrados para cerdos, esto ha sido una limitante para tener mas crianza de cerdos. Por esta razón he recurrido a la modalidad del crédito para invertir en materia prima y  poder de dicha forma satisfacer la demanda de mis clientes y aumentar mis ingresos económicos. En la foto observamo a Haydalina con su pequena crianza de cerdos.  Haydalina agradece la oportunidad del crédito a los inversionistas kiva por la ayuda que le brindan a personas de países pobres y con  muchas carencias económica como lo es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Haydalina is 48 years old. She is married and has three adult children. She lives Sauce, a village in the northern part of the country. Sauce is known for its dairy production, cow and pig raising, and typical pork dishes such as pork with cassava, pork adobado (with a spicy sauce), and fried pork. Haydalina been making her living raising pigs for the past seven years. She has encountered a few challenges of late, including low sales because she does not have enough capital to purchase pig feed, which has limited the number of pigs she can raise. She has therefore applied for a loan to buy raw materials that will allow her to satisfy her customers' demands and increase her income. The photo shows Haydalina and her little herd of pigs. Haydalina is grateful for the loan opportunities that Kiva lenders offer people from poor countries with widespread economic deprivation such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in buying and selling pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa is 30 years old, married, and the father of two children. For the last two years, he has earned a living by selling charcoal in Malindi town. He earns a monthly profit of about KES 11,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and is applying for his first loan, for KES 20,000, to buy additional charcoal to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he may give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. She sells green bananas at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 600,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business so as to serve more customers, and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es un joven de 27 años de edad, vive al lado de su hermana y su madre a quienes apoya mucho con el fruto de su trabajo, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, uva, entre otros. Jose aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente, ya que debido a sus pocos recursos económicos le fue un poco difícil culminar su carrera de administración, pero pudo concluirla, actualmente Jose trabaja en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, en el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo honrado.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo el podrá realizar los trámites de su titulo, lo cual le permitirá buscar un mejor empleo y poder trabajar y seguir adelante; de esta manera el seguirá luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre y poder ser un gran empresario”.
texts.en:
Jose is a 27 year old young man. He lives along with his sister and his mother who he supports with the fruits of his labor. His home is located in the city of Ica, a city that is characterized by its hot climate and its agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, asparagus, grapes, and other crops. Jose learned to earn his bread by the sweat of his brow, as, due to a lack of economic resources it was a little difficult for him to finish his business degree but he was able to complete it. Currently, Jose is working on a farm in his city, working about 9 hours a day. He believes he is doing well in his work because he is very responsible and, above all, honorable. 
Jose is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to their great support, he will be able to finish the certification for his professional degree which will enable him to seek better work and move ahead in life. He will keep fighting everyday to realize his greatest dream: "to give his mother a better life and to he be a successful businessman."

loans.use: to acquire a professional title.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is age 38. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 12, and they all go to schools. She has been a farmer for the past 18 years. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at the previous maize plantation, and she says that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and to support the labor costs of maize production.

loans.name: Divina Gracia Group

texts.es:
Las 12 integrantes  de este grupo son mujeres jefas de familia, que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ser mejores personas, el sueño de cada una de ellas es que sus familiares no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
Maria vende ropas y cuenta que le gusta su trabajo, ya que es asi como se gana la vida y como ayuda a su familia. Es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo honesta que trata siempre de superarse siempre.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere poder surtirse con todo tipo de prendas.
texts.en: The twelve women in this group are heads of household who work hard to succeed in life and become better people. They all share the same dream: that their families will not have to experience the same deprivations that they did.Maria sells clothing and says she likes her work because it allows her to make a living and support her family. She is a hardworking, honest person who always tries to improve her life. She is requesting this loan so she can buy summer clothing for the approaching hot season and carry a full range of clothing.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Monica R.

texts.en: Monica is 41 years old and she lives in the Airport community. She stopped her education in the 6th grade. Monica is married and has four children between 15 and 27 years old. She received money from her husband to start her business. For five years now she has been selling used clothes, and now she is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to expand her business in the near future and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ñañepytyvomba Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité Ñañepytyvomba decidieron adentrarse a este maravilloso emprendimiento que ofrece la  Fundación Paraguaya de otorgarles un credito siendo ellas humildes trabajadoras y sobre todo capacitarlas para que sepan utilizar esos recursos.
Presentacion es la presidenta del grupo, cuenta que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías en Karanday, que es un tipo de madera, cuenta que desde hace mucho hace este trabajo y que tiene buena venta, ya que sus artesanías son muy apreciadas, ella es una persona que pese a todo ha logrado salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita esta ayuda para utilizarla en la compra de karanday, pinturas, barnices y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus artesanías y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The modest and hardworking women of the Ñañepytyvomba communal bank decided to get involved in this wonderful entrepreneurship, a Fundación Paraguaya loan granted to them, above all to train them so they know how to use these resources.

Presentación is the president of the group.  She says she works making and selling handicrafts out of karanday, which is a type of wood.  She has done this work for a long time and has good sales because her pieces are highly prized.  She's someone who has managed to get ahead and help her family in spite of everything.

She's requesting this loan to buy karanday wood, paint, varnish, and other supplies to be able to continue making her handicrafts and so continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy karanday wood, paint, varnish, and other supplies

loans.name: Placida

texts.es: La Sra. Placida de  63 anos madres soltera con  excelente record crediticio, con 5 hijos mayores de edad, casados con familias propias. Ella corresponde al municipio del Sauce, una zona productora de leche y productos derivados. Y crianza de ganado. Placida tiene por actividad económica la compra de ganado   y venta de leche. Dicha actividad la realiza con ayuda de uno de sus hijos. Placida  tiene amplio record crediticio ha manejado créditos anteriores con gran responsabilidad y cancelados en tiempo y forma.  dichas actividades  son propias de la zona.Placida esta solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en la compra de ganado  y leche para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y tener mejores ganancias de su negocio. Placida agradece la ayuda que le brindan los prestamistas kiva a personas de escasos recurso para tener un medio de vida digno. En la foto observamos a Placida con una de sus vaquitas la cual le genera leche y vende  diariamente a los pobladores de su localidad.
texts.en: Placida is 63 years old. She is a single mother of five adult children, all of whom are married and have their own families. She has an excellent credit record. She lives in the village of Sauce, which lies in a dairy-producing and cattle-raising region.   Placida makes her living buying cows and selling milk. One of her sons helps her with her business. Placida has had a number of prior loans, which she has paid off quite responsibly in full and on time. Placida is requesting the loan so she can buy cows and milk to meet her customers' demand and bring in higher earnings in her business. Placida is grateful for the help she's gotten from Kiva's lenders, who offer people with few resources a chance at a decent life. The photo shows Placida with one of her little cows that she milks every day to sell to the people who live in her area.

loans.use: to invest in buying cows and milk to satisfy her customers' demand.

loans.name: Maribel Celestina

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 39 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, playas hermosas, atractivos turísticos muy visitados en todo el año como lo es las “Islas Ballestas” y el “Candelabro de Paracas”, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros. Maribel es muy trabajadora, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho jugar vóley con sus amigas de su barrio y en algunas ocasiones le encanat disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Aji de gallina”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos d sus padres ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de enfermería.

Día a día Maribel trabaja como agricultora, ella tiene una pequeña parcela en la cual ha sembrado maíz, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas diarias y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y apoyar a sus padres; ella cree que el va bien porque le gusta lo que hace y sobre todo por sus ganas de salir adelante.

Maribel está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a l ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar insecticidas, fertilizantes, abono, entre otros; de esta manera podrá tener un cultivo en buenas condiciones y poder tener una buena cosecha, así ella seguirá trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener más parcelas y ser una gran empresaria”.
texts.en:
Maribel is 39 years old and lives in Pisco, a city that is characterized by its hot climate, beautiful beaches, and world-class tourist attractions such as the Ballestas islands and a famous geoglyph called Candelabro de Paracas. It is an agricultural region where the common crops are cotton, corn, and others. Maribel is very hardworking but, when she has a little bit of free time, she loves to play volleyball with her friends in the neighborhood and, sometimes, she likes to enjoy one of her favorite dishes which is the delicious Aji de Gallina, a spicy chicken stew. Due to her parents having few economic resources, she was only able to study until the 5th grade of secondary school. But, she would have very much liked to study to be a nurse. 
Everyday, Maribel works as a farmer. She has a small plot of land which she has sown with corn. She works around 9 hours a day and, with the fruit of her labor, she can pay the household expenses and support her parents. She believes that she is doing will because she enjoys what she does and, above all, because she wants to get ahead.
Maribel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to the support that they have offered her, she will be able to buy insecticides, fertilizer, and other supplies. With these, she will be able to grow her crops in good conditions and to have a good harvest. She will continue working everyday to realize her greatest dream: "to have more land and be a good businesswoman."

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bertha Emerita

texts.es:
Quinindé un cantón de la Provincia de Esmeraldas que provee a varias ciudades del Ecuador productos como banano, cacao, café, palma africana y productos forestales y además el comercio es el trabajo diario de la mayoría de sus habitantes para poder salir adelante y más aún cuando han incrementado las vías para llegar a este cantón lo que ha permitido un gran movimiento comercial en especial los fines de semana en donde salen comerciantes de todo tipo a ofertar sus productos en la feria a sus potenciales clientes que la mayoría de veces suelen ser campesinos. El turismo también es un aporte muy importante para este cantón pues su ecosistema natural tiene mucha variedad de lugares para ser visitados cascadas, ríos de agua dulce,  bosques, que tienen flores y animales que adornan esta ciudad. Bertha tiene 34 años y reside en esta ciudad con su hijo, ella es soltera y cursó estudios hasta la secundaria.
 Bertha  dedica todo el día a su negocio de comida que se ubica en la zona central de la ciudad, actividad en la cual lleva 2 años y ahora piensa en mejorar la estructura del local para atraer más clientes, y así mejoren sus ingresos para darle una educación digna a su hijo y de esta forma llegue a ser un profesional. Para lograr este objetivo, ella se acercó a Fundación Alternativa a solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en compra de insumos y mano de obra para adecuar el restaurante con infraestructura de calidad como se merecen sus clientes.
texts.en:
Quinindé is a village in the province of Esmeraldas that produces bananas, cacao, African palm, hardwoods, and other goods for other cities in Ecuador. The inhabitants of the region work every day to succeed, and they've even built more roads to the village to accommodate increased commercial activity, especially on the weekends, when all sorts of merchants offer their products to potential customers--mostly local agricultural workers--in the local markets. Tourism also brings a lot of income to the region: its natural ecosystem offers a variety of places to visit, including waterfalls, rivers, and forests filled with flowers and animals.
Bertha is 34 years old and lives in this city with her son. She is single and went to school until high school.Bertha works all day in her downtown restaurant, which she's had for two years. She is planning to improve the space she occupies to attract more customers and increase her income. The increased earnings would allow her to offer her son a good education so he can have a successful career. She therefore approached the Fundación Alternativa to request a loan, which she will use to buy construction materials and pay for the labor to bring her restaurant up to the standard her customers deserve.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure in her commercial space.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité RENACER decidieron formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya, ya que vieron una gran oportunidad en este programa y quisieron poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de este.
Rosa se dedica a la costura y comenta que por medio de este trabajo ha podido salir adelante y ganarse el sustento diario para su familia. Ella es una persona que desea poder salir adelante y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a los suyos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra telas, hilos, agujas, etc, con lo cual podrá seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women of the loan group Renacer (Rebirth) decided to join the program for women entrepreneurs through the Fundación Paraguaya because they saw a great opportunity in this program and they wanted to be able to help their families. 
Rosa works as a seamstress and says that, by means of this work, she has been able to get ahead and cover her family's daily expenses. She is a person who wants to be successful so she keeps growing and helping her own.
She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, threads, needles, etc, which which she will be able to keep fulfilling her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Justice Group

texts.en:
This group has three women and one man. They sell fruits, barbering accessories, maize (corn) and plastic products. They have been with ID-Ghana since 2010 and are ambitious to be financially sustainable through the MFI flexible loan system. They meet every Monday to discuss business and repayment of loans.

Justice is a 40-year-old barber and barbering accessories seller. He is married to a 40-year-old hairdresser, and they have three children. He has been doing this job for 10 years. He is in his fifth loan cycle; the fourth loan of 500 Ghana cedis was used to build a container in which he operates the business now. He now needs 500 Ghana cedis to buy barbering accessories like a haircut machine and sterilization machine. The container is built beside the main high street of the town. He is able to make 80 Ghana cedis daily. 

They need a total of 1,650 Ghana cedis to be able to sustain their businesses.

loans.use: To buy barbering accessories like a haircut machine and sterilization machine.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene sells clothes to earn a living. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her to buy clothes for sale. This helped her business to improve, and with the additional income, she was able to cater for her family needs. She has requested a new loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings KES to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Regina   Nduku

texts.en:
Regina is 47 years old. She is married with four children who are in school. She sells both clothes and shoes in a competitive environment to earn a living. She has been in the business for more than 20 years and has employed two people to assist her in her business. 

She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her to grow her business. She dreams of owning a piece of land in the future. She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenyann shillings (KES) to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Mahougo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUGO est formé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, Colette Agossi, celle dont la main est levée sur la photo est âgée de 54 ans. Colette Agossi est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Jean et a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Colette Agossi a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses diverses charges, Colette Agossi vend des tissus par le système de distribution. Colette Agossi exerce cette activité depuis une trentaine d'année. Colette Agossi s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. En vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, Colette Agossi ambitionne agrandir son stock de vente ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Colette Agossi sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group MAHOUGO comprises five persons who reside in the same district and who belong to the same tontine. The group's representative, Colette Agossi, the one in the photo with her hand raised, is 54 years old and married to a mechanic named Jean. She has five children, all in school. 

Colette Agossi had dropped out of primary school. To cope with her various expenses, she sells cloth via the distribution system. She has been in this business for about thirty years. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin.

With the aim of boosting her business, Colette Agossi has the ambition to expand her inventory, and this will enable her to respond better to the demands of her customers. To do this, she is requesting, along with the other members of the group MAHOUGO, an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sell

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Las Marías, se conformó en el año 2008, el grupo  muy a gusto ya está en el 12° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable. Mary la presidenta vende leche y cuenta que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de lácteos, los cuales le servirán para poder seguir abasteciéndose y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women’s communal bank called Las Marías was formed in 2008. The group, very comfortably, is already in its 12th loan cycle in a joint and supportive manner within the program. They all run businesses to raise funds and help each other to meet the common objectives they all have within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya. They actively participate in meetings and they have an impeccably supportive work record. 

Mary, the president, sells milk and notes that she works from very early in the day. She is requesting a loan to purchase dairy products, which will enable her to continue stocking up so that she can meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase milk to sell.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND 3 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et sont liés par un lien de parenté. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Mègnonmi Malheme Fleuride est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Mègnonmi Malheme Fleuride est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Nansirou. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Mègnonmi Malheme Fleuride vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Mègnonmi Malheme Fleuride a très peu fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis plus de dix ans.De façon secondaire, Mègnonmi Malheme Fleuride vend des produits de cheveux et divers autres produits dans son atelier. Mègnonmi Malheme Fleuride s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Mègnonmi Malheme Fleuride n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Mègnonmi Malheme Fleuride et les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND 3, sollicitent ensemble un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group DIEU EST GRAND 3 comprises three persons who reside in the same district and who are united by ties of kinship. The group's representative, Mègnonmi Malheme Fleuride, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. This is the sixth time this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of boosting their business. 

Mègnonmi Malheme Fleuride is 37 years old and married to a man named Nansirou. The couple have three children, not all in school but all in their care. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly cover the diverse household expenses. 

Mègnonmi Malheme Fleuride has had very little schooling but learned how to style hair. Secondarily, she sells hair care products and a variety of other products in her salon. She gets her supplies from a  market in Benin.

Customer demand is growing more and more. And given her limited means, Mègnonmi Malheme Fleuride can no longer respond well to the requirements. In this regard, and given their limited resources, she and the other members of the group DIEU EST GRAND 3, is requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé. The previous loan have indeed been paid back.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and hair care products for her salon

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta is 40 years old and lives in Kakata with her husband and their four children. Her children are between the ages of 6 and 27 years old and are currently in school. Her husband is a businessman.

For the past eight years, she has been selling sardines, meat, biscuits, bread, and candy in her community. She is proud of her business because it enables her to generate profits and, with the profits, she improves her business and assists her husband in their home.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bread, biscuits, candy, and sardines to increase her sales. In the future, she plans on building a house.

loans.use: to increase sales by purchasing additional inventory (bread, biscuits, candy, and sardines)

loans.name: Michael   Kimani

texts.en:
Michael is a 32-year-old, married man with two children.

To earn a living, he operates a butcher shop. He has engaged in this business for seven years and has employed three people. To generate additional income, he runs a motorcycle transport business and operates a cafeteria.

He previously received a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to boost his business. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming financially stable in the future. He is now requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 KES to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Gbedandé Léontine

texts.fr: Agée de 52 ans, Gbedandé Léontine est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Le plus âgé a 35 ans et le moins a 18 ans. Elle a un restaurant où elle sert des mets ivoiriens depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue de renforcer son capital et de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de FINADEV. Ce financement lui permettra d'acheter des sacs de manioc, des cartons de spaghettis, des cartons de poissons, des saucisses, des casiers de boisson, des régimes de banane et de participer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Gbedandé Léontine, 52 years old, is married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 35 years old, and the youngest is 18. Gbedandé Léontine has a restaurant where she has been serving Ivorian dishes for a few years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

With the aim of bolstering her capital and satisfying the needs of her customers, she requested and obtained financing from Finadev. This financing will enable her to purchase sacks of cassava, boxes of spaghetti, boxes of fish, sausages, cases of drinks, and bunches of bananas. It will also help her to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, spaghetti, fish, sausages, drinks, and bananas for her restaurant

loans.name: Elvia Dinora

texts.es:
Elvía, solicita un nuevo préstamo, pues quiere seguir trabajando en el negocio ya que considera que estos préstamos son de mucha ayuda para comprar sus productos, ella invertirá en la compra de camarones, pescado, también algunas verduras como tomate, cebolla, repollo, esperando tener la aceptación de los clientes y de aumento en las ventas.

El préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo que le facilitó la obtención de ganancias del negocio se ha  comprado algunos bienes del hogar y  una enciclopedia para el estudio de sus hijas.
texts.en: Elvia is asking for a new loan because she wants to continue working in the business since she considers these loans to be of great help for her to buy her products.  She will buy shrimp, fish and also some vegetables like tomatoes, onions and cabbage hoping to be well-received by her customers and having increased sales.  The previous loan had a positive effect in that it made it easier for her to earn business profits.  She’s purchases some things for the house and an encyclopedia to help with her daughters’ school work.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, fish, tomatoes, onions, cabbage.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 24 years old and lives in Airport. She is married and has a two-month-old child.

For the past two years, she has been operating a restaurant. She explains that she has many customers because she runs the only restaurant in her community; plus, the restaurant is in a very good location.

At present, she is need of capital. As a result, she is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business, including rice, fish, meat, and pepper. In the future, her plan is to buy land and build a home for her family.

loans.use: to improve and expand her restaurant business by purchasing additional ingredients (including rice, fish, meat, and pepper)

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Silvio José, de 37 anos de edad, soltero sin hijos. Del municipio de Malpaisillo del departamento de León. Un lugar que se caracteriza por se un zona agrícola en la siembra de diferentes cultivos como, Plátanos, maíz, arroz. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de tajadas (las tajadas  es un comida típica de Nicaragua elaborada con platos verdes se cortan y se ponen a freír, y se acompañan con repollo picado) además venden  papas fritas y fritanga. Tiene 14 anos en su negocio, tiene amplio record  crediticio ya que  es excelente paga en tiempo y forma. Y esta ubicado en una zona comercial de malpaisillo. Este negocio lo inicie por esfuerzo propio y lo aprendí viviendo en Costa Rica. En la actualidad siempre se presenta desafíos y  problemas como es la enfermedad de mi Mama. (Presión Arterial) El financiamiento lo necesito para invertir en materia prima como es la compra de plátanos verde para elaborar  las tajadas. Agradezco la oportunidad que los inversionistas kiva le brinda a pequeños comerciantes de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para poder tener un medio de vida digno, y ayudar a erradicar un poco la pobreza en nuestro país. “Gracias prestamistas kiva”
texts.en:
Silvio José is 37 years old, single, and has no children.  He lives in the town of Malpaisillo in the department of León, which is known for being an agricultural area with crops such as plantains, corn, and rice.  Silvio José works selling tajadas (a typical dish in Nicaragua made by cutting and frying green plantains which is served with chopped cabbage), fried potatoes, and other fried foods.  He has had this business for 14 years.  He has a full credit history since he always pays on time and in full.  His business is located in the commercial area of Malpaisillo.  He started this business with his own initiative and learned about it while he was living in Costa Rica.  

Currently he is facing challenges and problems, including his mother's illness (blood pressure).  He is requesting this loan to invest in ingredients such as green plantains to make tajadas.  He appreciates the opportunity that Kiva loans provide to small businesses with few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua.  He says thank you to Kiva lenders for the ability to have a decent way of life and for helping to eradicate poverty a little in his country.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make tajadas (green plantains).

loans.name: Fatimatou

texts.fr: Fatimatou est âgée de 27 ans. Mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés, le plus âgé a 8 ans et le moins âgé a 03 mis. Spécialisée dans la vente des pâtes dentifrices et des produits cosmétiques depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Le bénéfice dégagé lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Fatimatou is 27 years old, married, and the mother of three children, of whom two are in school. The oldest is 8 years old, and the youngest is 3 months old. Specialized in selling toothpaste and cosmetic products for several years, she gets her supplies from one of the  markets in Benin.

Concerned about bolstering her business capital and satisfying the needs of her customers, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from FINADEV. The profits earned will enable her to help cover her children's schooling costs and meet their needs.

loans.use: to purchase toothpaste, toothbrushes, and cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela tiene 35 años de edad, vive a escasa distancia del centro de la ciudad de Itá, está acompañada hace mas de 8 años, tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, se dedica a la compra-venta de bebidas en general hace mas de 5 años.
La señora Graciela solicita el préstamo para la construcción de una casilla en su domicilio a modo de brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y también para su comodidad, ya que actualmente sus congeladores los tiene en su cocina.
Su meta es poder seguir creciendo cada vez más y sabe que esta ayuda la hará crecer mucho más.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela is 35 years old and lives a short distance from the center of the city of Itá. She has been with her partner for more than 8 years and has a school-aged son. She has been buying and selling drinks, in general, for more than 5 years.

Sra. Graciela is requesting a loan to build a stall at her home so her clients will be more comfortable and also for her own comfort because currently her freezers are in the kitchen.

Her goal is to continue to grow more and she knows that this will help her grow much more.

loans.use: to build a stall for greater comfort in making her sales.

loans.name: Faoziatou Adétola

texts.fr: Agée de 29 ans, Faoziatou Adétola est mariée et mère d'un enfant âgé d'un an. Elle vend des boîtes de conserve, du savon et d'autres articles depuis 05 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Soucieuse de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de couvrir les besoins de ses clients, Faoziatou Adétola a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à FINADEV-SA. Ce crédit lui permettra de renforcer son stock de marchandise et de contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Faoziatou Adétola, 29 years old, is married and the mother of a 1-year-old child. Faoziatou Adétola has been selling canned foods, soaps, and a variety of other goods for five years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin and from abroad. Concerned about bolstering her purchasing power and meeting the needs of her customers, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from FINADEV-SA. This loan will enable her to bolster her stock of merchandise and to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase macaroni, milk, sardines, canned tomatoes, and soap to sell

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley has been a mixed crop farmer for the past five years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his second loan from  KADET LTD. after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

Stanley will use the loan to buy a dairy cow. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand on the farming. His hopes and dreams are to expand on the farming business and improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DURABANK, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Avelina tiene 37 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de elaboración de aretes,collares,pulseras entre otros hechos en plata, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio, la socia cuenta con un pequeño taller donde elabora su mercadería el cual se encuentra en su casa, la socia distribuye su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como tiendas de turismo, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pulidores y para la compra de cochas marinas.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
Avelina is a member of the community bank Durabank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.  She is 37 years old, married, and has four children. 

Avelina balances her daily activities with a business making earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and other jewelery from silver.  She is doing well with this business thanks to the effort she puts in.  She has a small workshop where she makes her merchandise in her house.  She distributes her merchandise to her customers that request them, such as tourist shops.  She is a responsible and hard-working person who tries to improve her family's life.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase polish and seashells.  She is thankful for the loan provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase polish and seashells.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is from the village of Martvili district. He is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two children (17 and 23 years old). 

Zurab works as an operator at the local petrol station and gets a monthly salary. His wife has chronic health problems and gets a relevant pension from the local government. Zurab runs an animal husbandry business; he has two milk cows, four calves and 14 sheep. His wife milks the cows and sheep to produce cheese products. In addition, the family owns a plot of land where persimmons are grown. Zurab produces dried persimmons. The family sells their agricultural production and lambs at the local open market. Zurab works hard to make some savings and improve the living conditions of the family. 

He requested a loan to purchase additional sheep and expand the cattle shed. He plans to enlarge the animal husbandry, but the existing cattle shed doesn’t allow him to implement this plan. Once his cattle shed is expanded, he will produce more cheese and sell lambs. This will increase the income of the family.  Zurab will reinvest the additional earnings to expand his agricultural enterprise and make it more profitable. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep and expand the cattle shed.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
El  Sr. Bernardino es de la ciudad de Santaní,  tiene 38 años, está casado con la Sra. Maura de 33 años, con quien tiene dos hijos aun pequeños, quienes son la razón de lucha de la pareja.
Bernardino tiene  una frutería y verdulería en el Mercado Municipal, ocupa dos puestos de trabajo, cuenta que tiene una clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, el es un señor muy trabajador, excelente cliente.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras para poder abastecer su negocio con todos esos productos para poder seguir dando a sus clientes la calidad a la que estaban acostumbrados.
texts.en:
Bernardino is from the city of Santaní.  He is 38 years old, married to Maura, 33, and they have two children, who are small, but who are the couple's reason to struggle for success.  

Bernadino has a business selling fruits and vegetables at the town market.  He occupies two stands.  He has a fixed customer base, good income, and good business and personal references.  He is a hardworking man and an excellent client.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables to stock his store with products to be able to continue giving his customers the quality they expect from him.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for his store.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married, and she has three children. She runs a very well-supplied fast food store, and she is a very hardworking and tenacious woman, always making efforts to get ahead in life.

Mejumaa told us she started working in this field more than 10 years ago because there was a need for a general store in her neighborhood, and little by little, she has been able to grow thanks to her work.

She is requesting a loan to buy more general products such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, oil and baked products. Thanks to this investment, she will keep on selling high quality food, consequently increasing her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy more general products such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, oil and baked products.

loans.name: Liberta

texts.en:
Liberta is 32 years old. She is married and has two children, age 7 and 9, who go to school. She has been a farmer for the past 15 years. 

She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production; she needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The photo was taken recently at the previous maize plantation and says that the last season went well. The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support the labor costs in the maize production.

loans.name: Gogita

texts.en:
Gogita is from the village of Tskaltubo district. He is 24 years old and lives with his parents and 15-year-old brother. His brother goes to the local school. 

Gogita's economic activity is a greenhouse where tomatoes, cucumbers and different kinds of greens are grown. Gogita does all the relevant seasonal work to insure a good harvest. The harvested production is sold locally. 

In addition, the family runs a small dairy farm and has four milk cows, whose milk is used for cheese products. They sell cheese to cheese retailers.  Gogita works hard to make some savings and expand his agricultural business. 

He requested a loan to expand his greenhouse and purchase organic fertilizers. The loan will help him to provide financially for his needs. After fertilization and properly done agricultural work, Gogita will receive the good quality harvest and sell it for a good price. This will increase the income of the family. The increased income will be reinvested in his agricultural business to expand and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to expand his greenhouse and purchase organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Flor De Nardo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama flor de nardo  y se integra de tres señoras quien cada una se dedica a trabajar en diferente actividad y viven en un barrio en el pueblo de coapilla.
 
   Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Ernestina quien es casada con el señor Virgilio como quien procreo cuatro hijos quienes dos ya son profesionistas y tres a un están estudiando y viven en una casita humilde en donde comenta que acido  muy feliz.

    Ella trabaja el préstamo  desde hace cuatro ciclos y es para invertirlo en la compra  de ingredientes como  son: harina-huevo- aceite- queso- entre otros para la elaborar panes en donde lleva trabajando  diesi siete años y siete meses en la que comenta que  le van bien ya que con ello  ha estado sacando adelante a su  familia.

   Se dedica a esta actividad ya que su mama fue quien la enseño a trabajar de esta manera para tener sus propios  ingresos  y darle lo mas necesario a su  familia a un que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo también quiere aportar.
 
   Comenta que lo  que más desea es que con el tiempo sus hijos puedan seguir adelante y con el apoyo que les están brindando trabajar muy duro para que ellos tenga lo suficiente para estudiar.
 
   Quienes integran en el grupo son: la señora Vitalina quien trabaja el préstamo  en la compra de  frutas y legumbres y la señora Candelaria invertirá en la compra de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This group is called Flor de Nardo and is made up of three women who work in different activities and live in a neighborhood in the town of Coapilla.

Ernestina did the interview.  She's married to Virgilio, with whom she had four children, two of whom are professionals and three of whom are students.  They live in a modest little house where she has been very happy.
 
She has been working with loans for four cycles and it's to invest in buying ingredients such as flour, eggs, oil, cheese, and others, to make bread.  She's been doing this work for 17 years and 7 months, and it's going well for her because with it she has gotten her family ahead.

She does this work because her mother taught her to do it to have her own income and give her family what they most need.  She still has the help of her husband, who also wants to contribute.

She says that what she most wants is for her children to be able to move forward in the future and to have enough for them to study with the support she's giving them with her hard work.

The members of the group are Vitalina, who is getting a loan to buy fruit and vegetables, and Candelario, who will invest in fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Bissignon Group

texts.fr: BISSIGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Pascaline Médégnonmi(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un couturier du nom de Videkon. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pascaline Médégnonmi et son mari et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pascaline Médégnonmi n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Il y a près de dix ans que Pascaline Médégnonmi mène comme activité la vente de cartes de recharges téléphoniques à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Pascaline Médégnonmi vend des cartes SIM. Pascaline Médégnonmi exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Pascaline Médégnonmi s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Pascaline Médégnonmi sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe BISSIGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
BISSIGNON is a group of three persons whose members are friends belonging to the same tontine group. The group's representative (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 38 years old and married to a tailor named Videkon. The couple have two children, all in school and in their care.  She and her husband jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

Pascaline Médégnonmi did not attend school. For nearly ten years, she has been running a business selling mobile phone minutes recharge cards out of her home. On the side, she sells SIM cards. She operates her business with passion, and this enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies from her region.

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Pascaline Médégnonmi is requesting, along with the other members of the group BISSIGNON, a fourth loan, which will be used to respond better to customer demands and to make more profit. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase phone minutes recharge cards to sell from home

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia continua con su negocio de picanteria,la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende diferentes tipos de comida extras como milaneza de pollo,chicharron(cerdo),platos tipicos entre otros,la socia a la vez vende bebidas como chicha de jora,cerveza,gaseosas ,la socia trabaja todos los dias en su negocio desde las 09:00am hasta las 10:00pm aproximadamente,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cerveza para su negocio.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Fuente De Vida” (Fountain of Life).  The bank is located in the Huanchac District of Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

The member still has her restaurant.  She has been in the business for years, and it has been going well for her because of the effort she puts into it every day.  She sells different types of food like "milaneza de pollo" (chicken breast fried in breadcrumbs), cracklings, and other local fare.  She also sells beverages like "chicha de jora" (an alcoholic drink made from fermented corn), beer and soda.  Fortunata works in her restaurant every day from approximately 9:00am until 10:00pm.  She is a responsible and hard-working person, which is how she has been able to get her family ahead. 

Fortunata is requesting the loan in order to purchase beer for her business. 

She is grateful for the help that she will be granted, and she promises to be disciplined in the repayment of her loan.

loans.use: to purchase beer for her restaurant.

loans.name: Dushyigikirane 24 A / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Onesphore est le membre et le président du groupe Dushyigikirane No 24 A /Rsz. Le nom du groupe signifie «Supporte l’une à l’autre».Il a 37 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 3 ans à 10 ans, deux de ses enfants sont scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est 8ième primaire.

Onesphore est cultivateur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB et il dit que le crédit antérieur a aidé ses activités de l’agriculture de riz beaucoup et il n’a pas attendue aucunes difficultés de non remboursement du crédit. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour acheter des champs utiliser pour agrandir l’étendu de leur agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait une maison de stock de ses produits agricoles. Avec les profits, il prévoit de réhabilite sa maison, payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Onesphore is a member and the president of the group Dushyigikirane No 24 A /Rsz. The group's name means "Supporting one another". He is 37 years old and married, and he has three children aged 3 to 10 years old. Two of the children are in school. He has an 8th grade education.

Onesphore is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his third one with the microfinance institution ACB. He says the previous loan helped his rice farming a great deal, and he expected no difficulties at all in repaying the loan. He is going to use his loan to purchase fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor for his rice farm.

To increase his rice farming, he plans to request more loans in order to purchase fields to extend his farming. In the next few years, he would like to have a building for stocking his produce. With the profits, he plans on renovating his house and to pay the schooling and medical costs for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto es un joven de 18 años de edad, vive en la calidad y generosa ciudad de Chincha, la cual se caracteriza además por ser la cunda de grandes glorias del deporte  peruano, asimismo sus pobladores tienen un maravilloso don para la preparación de platillos, ya que lo hacen de manera muy deliciosa, es una ciudad donde se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería y sobre todo donde se practica uno de los bailes típicos de nuestro país el cual es el festejo, la zamacueca, landó, entre otros. Humberto es muy trabajador, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho escuchar música, pero en algunas ocasiones le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “ceviche”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Humberto trabaja en una empresa textil, el labora alrededor de 12 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de vivienda a duras penas; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Humberto está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la gran ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, en especial realizar refacciones en las paredes y realizar  instalaciones para tubería de agua, ya que actualmente las tuberías están oxidadas , de esta manera el podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:”Estudiar una profesión”.
texts.en:
Humberto is an 18 year old young man who lives in the fine and generous city of Chincha, known as well for being the cradle of Peruvian sports greats and for its inhabitants, who have a marvelous talent for preparing delicious food. This is a city based on agriculture and livestock and above all a place where the indigenous dances of the country are performed, such as the “festejo,” “zamacueca,” and “landó,” among others. 

Humberto is very hardworking however when he has a little spare time he enjoys listening to music and occasionally he loves eating one of his favorite dishes, the very delicious “ceviche.”  Due to his scare financial resource he was only able to study until the fifth year of secondary school, however he would have liked to have attended the university.

Day after day, Humberto works in a textile business. He works about 12 hours a day and with the fruit of his work is barely able to pay his living expenses; he believes things are going well at work because he is very eager to get ahead. 

Humberto is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their great help, he will be able to make improvements on his dwelling, specifically repair the walls and install water piping because currently  the pipes are rusty. Consequently he will be able to improve his quality of life and continue working to make his greatest dream a reality, that of “studying a profession.”

loans.use: to improve his dwelling (repair the walls and replace the piping)

loans.name: Maalyir Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA  représente le groupe  MAALYIR. Elle se porte bien ainsi que toute sa famille. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 22ans et le moins âgé a 17ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 02personnes en charge.

Mme vend des ignames, des beignets et des gâteaux depuis 18ans. Son ancien crédit s’est bien déroulé. Elle s’approvisionne à la cité AN II. Ses clients sont les voisins et les habitants du quartier.

Mme veut s’acheter de 02calebassés d’ignames  par semaine et 02sacs haricot pour préparer les beignets.

Mme veut renforcer son activité avec ses économies. Son  ambition reste le même à savoir: acheter les haricots pour stocker et revendre en cas de soudure. Elle compte puiser dans ce stock pour faire ses beignets.
texts.en:
Ms. AMINATA represents the group MAALYIR. She is doing well, as is her whole family. She is married and the mother of two children. The oldest is 22 years old, and the youngest is 17. One goes to school. Ms. AMINATA has two persons to support.

She has been selling yams, beignets, and cakes for eighteen years. Her former loan went well. She gets her supplies from the AN II district. Her customers are neighbors and area residents. 

She wants to purchase 2 basins of yams per week and 2 sacks of beans in order to make beignets.

She wants to bolster her business with her savings. Her ambition remains the same, namely to purchase beans to stock up and to resell them in case of shortages. She intends on drawing from this stock to make her beignets.

loans.use: to purchase yams and beans and to make fritters.

loans.name: Bonifrida

texts.en:
Bonifrida is 55. She is married and has 7 children, all go to schools. She has been a farmer for the past 30 years. She will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production: she needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 
The photo taken recently at the previous maize plantation and says that the last season went well. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor cost during maize production.

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en:
Edna is 35 years old married with five children. She has been in the Agro-vet business for the last one year earning approximately KES.8,000 monthly. 

This is Edna’s second loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loan. She borrowed KES.20,000 and plans to use it on purchasing insecticides and animal feeds. 

With the anticipated profits she plans to plough it back into the agro-vet business. She hopes to join the National agrovet services board.

loans.use: To purchase insecticides and animal feeds for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten bundles of wheat four, 15 bags of sugar, 180 litres of kerosene and 5 bags of rice to sell at her general store

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 58 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have nine children aged between 3 and 21. He has been a maize farmer for 25 years.
