To help her continue operations of her business, Noraida is requesting a Php 20,000 loan to pay for spare parts, accessories and the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Noraida dreams of giving her family a good life through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Maria Santano

texts.es: Doña María de 60 años es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposo y una hija en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Ella es muy emprendedora, tiene su negocio desde hace 20 años, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, como arroz, manteca, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, churros, refrescos, y también vende sandalias y algunos útiles escolares. y como otros ingresos también cuenta con la producción y venta de productos lácteos como queso y mantequilla o crema. El préstamo que está solicitando por 5,000 Lempiras lo va invertir en la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, harina, manteca, papel higiénico y refrescos. Con esta inversión va incrementar sus ventas porque va tener más surtido de productos nuevos. Su meta es incrementar los ingresos para ayudar a su hija con algunos gastos de la universidad.
texts.en:
María is 60 years old and married. She has two children, and lives with her husband and a daughter in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida. 

She is very enterprsing, and has had her store for 20 years. Here she sells basic household necessities, such as rice, lard, beans, sugar, corn, churros (treat made with fried dough) and soft drinks. She also sells sandals and some school supplies. 

The loan of 5,000 lempiras she is requesting, she is going to use to purchase corn, beans, rice, flour, lard, toilet paper and soft drinks. 

With this investment, she is going to increase her sales, because she is going to have a greater supply of new products.

Her goal is to increase her income, in order to help her daughter with some university expenses.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, rice, flour, lard, toilet paper and soft drinks for stocking her store.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El señor  Roberto tiene 59 años, con hijos ya independientes, sigue con su actividad que es la administración de un baño público de su propiedad, el Sr.  Roberto vive en casa propia y su negocio   se encuentra en  el mismo domicilio es trabajador   ya que cuenta  con varios negocios el préstamo lo invertirá en la refacción de algunos ambientes de su domicilio el está muy feliz por el apoyo brindado ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien.
texts.en: Roberto, 59, is continuing to work in his business.  He runs a public bathroom which is on his property. His children are already independent.  Roberto lives in his own home, and his business is located in his home.  He is hardworking, and has several businesses.  He will use this loan to make some repairs to his house.  He is very happy with the support being provided, because it went very well with his previous loan.

loans.use: to make some repairs to his house

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La Sra. Hilda tiene 31 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos que son de las edades de 10, 7  años y una bebe de 4 meses,  ella se dedica a la venta de papelería, material de escritorio,  libros etc. Ella vende variedad de productos según a la temporada, tiene ubicado su bazar librería en la zona de Chasquipampa en un lugar muy concurrido de la zona Sur, ella vive en casa familiar, ella solicita el crédito para proveerse de mercadería con la compra de material escolar para su librería – bazar ya que le va muy bien ya que por la ubicación del negocio tiene una buena venta y es una persona que cumple con sus pagos, es responsable y trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Hilda is 31 years old, married with three children who are 10 years old, 7 years old, and a baby of 4 months. She works selling stationery supplies, writing materials, books, etc.

She sells a variety of products according to the season. Her bookstore-bazaar is located in the area of Chasquipampa in a very busy place in the southern area. She lives in the family home. She is asking for a loan in order to stock up on merchandise with the purchase of school supplies for her bookstore-bazaar which is going very well and has good sales because of the location. She is a person that meets her payments, is trustworthy and hardworking, and is grateful with the institution for the provided support.

loans.use: to buy school supplies in order to stock up on merchandise for her stationery store

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда замужем. У нее трое сыновей.  Двое получают высшее образование, а младший учится в школе.  Надежда имеет собственный бизнес.

Надежда занимается выездной торговлей на протяжении 15 лет. Она торгует носками, нижним бельем, тапочками и т.д. У Надежды хорошие взаимоотношения с окружающими, поэтому проблем с торговлей нет.  У нее есть цель развивать бизнес и увеличивать доход, что бы обеспечивать семью.

Надежда просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10000 гривен на закупку товара к осенне-зимнему сезону.
texts.en: Nadezhda is married and has three children. Two are in college, and the youngest is in primary school.  Nadezhda has her own business: she has been doing traveling sales for 15 years. She sells socks, underwear, slippers, etc. Nadezhda gets along well with people, so selling comes easily to her. Her goal is to grow her business and increase her income to provide for her family. Nadezhda is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 grivnas to buy merchandise for the fall-winter season.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the fall-winter season

loans.name: Prodencio

texts.en: Prodencio, 53 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Lapasan, Clarin, with three children. He is earning a living from his auto repair shop. He started it almost 25 years ago and he earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. To improve his business, he borrowed 15,000 PHP from GDMPC (which he just joined last 2006) to obtain accessories and tires. Prodencio’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Maria Yamileth

texts.es: María, tiene 32 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su madre, sobrina, esposo e hijo. María tiene 5 años de haber decidido vender mercadería como camisetas, cosméticos, champú, cremas,  jeans, pantalones cortos, y ropa interior. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por encargos. Ella ha sido cliente de ODEF con varios prestamos, con el actual de 15,000 lempiras son 10 ciclos y han sido para mantener activo su negocio y obtener los ingresos para la manutención de su familia. El préstamo lo usara para surtir de ropa, cosméticos y joyas con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Su meta es seguir con el negocio para mejorar su casa y darle la educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is 32, married, and has a son. She lives in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida, with her mother, niece, husband and son. 

It is five years since María decided to sell merchandise such as T-shirts, cosmetics, shampoo, creams, jeans, shorts and underwear. 

She sells door-to-door and through orders. She has been a client of ODEF for several loans. With the current one for 15,000 lempiras it makes ten loans. 

These have been to keep her business going and to obtain the income for supporting her family. 

She will use the loan to stock up on clothing, cosmetics and jewelry, with the aim of increasing her sales and her income. 

Her goal is stay in business, in order to improve her home and provide her son with an education.

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Yessenia Margarita

texts.es:
Yessenia empezó vendiendo bebidas para aumentar sus ingresos en la parte delantera de su casa.Escogió esta actividad porque no había por el sector donde vive el negocio de venta de bebidas.

Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos por eso ahora su trabajo lo hace sola desde las 7:00am hasta las 18:00pm en donde vende bebidas, dulces, papeleria etc.

Yessenia es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos de 17 años y 8 años y estudian en escuela y colegio fiscal. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su necgoio por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo bebias y papeleria. Unas de sus metas es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Yessenia started selling drinks from the front part of her house to improve her income.  She chose this type of business because there was no place that sells drinks in the area where she lives.

She has slowly been improving her income and carries out her work alone from 7:00am to 6:00pm selling drinks, sweets, stationary etc. 

Yessenia is a single mother and has two children of 17 and 8 years old who are studying at primary and high school. She has many dreams for her business and for this reason she wants to use the loan to but drinks and stationary. One of her goals is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks and stationary.

loans.name: San Cristobal - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SAN CRISTOBAL – 26 está  compuesto por nueve integrantes seis mujeres y tres varones, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Adelia tiene 29 años, es casada con un hijito de cuatro años de edad vive por la zona de San Cristóbal,   La Sra. Adelia,  se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su sexta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Adelia va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de productos para surtir su negocio como abarrotes y refrescos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Adelia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Adelia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Enterprising Bank of San Cristobal-26 is comprised of nine members, six are female and three are male. The president of the bank is Adelia she is 29 years old and is married with a 4-year-old child. She lives in the area of San Cristóbal. Adelia owns a store in the area where she lives selling a variety of customer staples. 

This loan is the sixth from the institution. Adelia is going to use the loan to purchase a variety of products such as groceries and soft drinks for her business. With these goods she will provide a variety of products to her customers. The reason she is requesting a loan is to continue to grow her business. 

Adelia is going to use the loan to continue to buy products and improve her income. Her dream for her business is to have a bigger store and therefore provide better service to her customers. 

Adelia is a hard working person and she is happy for the opportunity given to her and her group members. Many of the members sole breadwinners of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as groceries and soft drinks for the business

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino de 25 años de edad, convive con Margarita de 25 años y fruto de ese amor, tienen a su pequeño hijo Luis; viven en su propia casa, construido habase de material rustico. Sabino, asegura que el producto de café se ha convertido en los últimos años en un gran negocio, no solo para él, sino para el resto de los campesinos, desde luego que está sacando el máximo provecho a sus plantaciones. Cada año va tomando presencia en su localidad, de esta manera trata de mejorar en cuanto a la calidad de su producto.
En tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesita el apoyo de los jornaleros, con la finalidad de culminar de manera ágil su trabajo. Su punto de venta lo realiza en los centros de acopio a 1 hora de su comunidad. Con el dinero del crédito comprará fertilizantes naturales para la buena producción de sus plantas de café. Este es su crédito número 02, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además siente que llegará lo más lejos posible con su banco comunal, ya que todos están conformes por el buen manejo de su grupo.
Con el préstamo de 1,000 nuevos soles, hará la compra de abono natural para el buen mantenimiento y buena producción de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Sabino is 25 years old and lives with Margarita who is also 25 years old. From the fruit of their love they have a small child, Luis. They live in their own home made of rustic materials. 

Sabino ensured that over the past few years that the coffee product has grown to a good business, not only for him, but also for the rest of the farmers. He maximizes the benefits of his plantations. Every year he has more of a business presence in his town so he tries to improve the quality of his product. In times of harvesting and weeding he needs help from laborers, with the purpose to expedite his work. He sells his product in the collection center, 1 hour from his community. 

With the money from the loan he will buy natural fertilizers for the production of his coffee plants. This is his second loan, for which he promises to maintain his payment schedule. He will continue to advance with this community bank because people are happy with his efforts. With the loan of 1000 soles, he will buy natural fertilizers for the maintenance and improved production of his crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
"Patience pays," says Veronica. "Without it, you would not bear fruits to harvest someday," she adds. Her dream is to save for her children's education in college, for she believes that education is the only resource she can give them that cannot be stolen by anyone.    

Veronica, 35 years old, is married with three school-age children. She is managing a general store in her village somewhere in Mallig. She rolled approximately 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) into the business four years ago. Each month, Veronica's income ranges from 10,000 PHP to 20,000 PHP, including her husband's monthly earnings from his charcoal-making activity. 

Now Veronica is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan as additional capital to roll into her store and use to buy stock of groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, baked breads, candies and many more. Veronica also wants to buy hog feed, rice and rice bran as added products to offer in the store in order to further increase her income for the future welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, baked breads, candies, hog feed, rice and rice bran.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is a responsible housewife who aims to become successful someday. She is 31 years old and was blessed with two children. 

For lack of job opportunities, she engages in the hog-raising business to help her husband in generating income. She aimed to strengthen the business and generate sufficient income to satisfy the family's needs and save for the future of their children.  

She planned to acquire more piglets to raise for fattening, but she has not enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 40,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She believes this financial assistance will be a great help for her to work out her plan, and she is hoping that someday, she will make the business grow and profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, who is 43 years old and a resident of Manila, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses. 
 
Evangeline operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is to buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then resell them with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy by her low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evangeline hopes to be able to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.ru:
Виктория не замужем. У нее есть сын Алексей. Виктория имеет свой  бизнес.

Виктория занимается продажей детской одежды на центральном рынке города на протяжении  7 лет.  Торговое место у нее собственное, есть постоянные покупатели. Виктория дружелюбная, ответственная и трудолюбивая.

Виктория просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 12000 гривен на закупку осенней детской одежды. Кредит поможет ей увеличить прибыль, и тем самым улучшить быт ее семьи.
texts.en: Viktoria is single, and has a son, Aleksei. Viktoria has her own business; she has been selling children's clothing at the town's central market for 7 years. She has her own retail outlet and has regular customers. Viktoria is friendly, responsible, and hardworking. She has asked for a loan in the amount of 12,000 hrivnas to buy children's fall clothing. The loan will help to increase her income, and improve her family's standard of living, too.

loans.use: to buy children's fall clothing

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en: Edwina is 49 years old and single. She is from Molicay, Ozamis City. She has been raising bananas for five years and earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Edwina joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina is 25 years old, married, and a hardworking woman who is living in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband. She does not have any children. Her husband is running a welding shop and she wants to invest some amount into his business, as he needs some machinery for his shop. 

Since 2010, she herself has been working as a social worker and an efficient tailor and is interested in increasing her tailoring business.

For that, as a member of a six-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new tailoring machine and clothing material for her business. 

She prays for her husband's healthy and long life. She is very thankful to Brac and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine and clothing material for her business.

loans.name: Triunfadoras Cananvalle Group

texts.es:
Triunfadoras Cananvalle es una sociedad de tres personas emprendedoras que tienen un mismo objetivo que es el de ayudar a sus familias a mejorar su calidad de vida, de esta sociedad la presidenta es Miryan la señorita del medio en la fotografía; Miryan es una persona trabajadora y le gusta salir adelante.

Este grupo se dedica a la crianza y venta de gallinas y pollos, este negocio lo tienen mucho tiempo y poco a poco las compañeras se han unido para tener un buen capital de trabajo y que sus utilidades sean mayores, al momento necesitan invertir en la construcción de galpones solo para gallinas que van a empollar huevos y para la compra de balanceado para sus gallinas y pollos.

Estas tres personas emprendedoras sueñan en un futuro construir más galpones y comprar más crías para que su negocio genere más ingresos.
texts.en:
“Triunfadoras Cananvalle” is a group of three enterprising individuals. They have the same goal of helping their families achieve a better quality of life. The group president is Miryan, the young woman who is in the middle of the photograph. Miryan is a hardworking person who likes to get ahead.

This group raises and sells hens and chickens. The business takes up much of their time, and gradually the partners have joined together to build up a large amount of working capital and generate better profits. At the moment, they need to build coops where the hens can lay their eggs. They will also buy balanced feed for the hens and chickens.

In the future, these three enterprising individuals plan to build more chicken coops and buy more birds to raise so that their business can generate more income.

loans.use: to build a henhouse and buy poultry feed.

loans.name: 34-Emprendimiento-34 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 34-EMPRENDIMIENTO-34 está  compuesto por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un varón,   la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Ana tiene 30 años, es casada tiene cuatro hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución es cliente antigua, la Sra. Ana  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de de insumos como arroz, fideo y papa por mayor  para la elaboración de sus platillos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de platillos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Ana va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Ana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Enterprising Bank 34, is comprised of 9 members, 8 women and one man. The president of the bank is Ana, a 30 year old married woman with 4 school age children. She has a food stand in the same area where she lives. This is her third loan with the group and she has a credit history. Ana will use this loan to buy bulk purchase of rice, pasta, and potatoes to make meals. This way she will offer a variety of meals to her customers. The reasons she is requesting the loan is to continue to improve her business. 

Ana is using the loan to continue buying more goods and improve her income. Her dream for her business is to have a restaurant and provide better service to her customers. 

Ana is a hard working person and is happy for the opportunity given to her and her team members who in many cases are the sole breadwinners of their family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale rice, pasta, and potatoes.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion, 38 years old, is now a widow for two years. Her husband died in 2010 due to hypertension. She is a mother of two children, both in their elementary grades. Her income in the business goes towards the welfare of her children. 

As a single parent, Visitacion works hard to succeed in the businesses she manages. She runs a store where she invested PHP 50,000 as current revolving capital. Activities that made Visitacion busy most of the time are the simple buying and selling of corn during harvest season using the PHP 20,000 initial capital.

She wants to borrow PHP 30,000 that will be used as additional capital in her store. She will buy stock of different grocery items like noodles, canned goods, soda, powdered juice, bread, and many more items. Some of the loan will also be invested in corn to buy and sell to get a bigger income. As she said, the bigger the capital, the bigger the income.

Someday, when her business revolving fund is stable, she wants to develop a grocery store in their place.  Her corn buying and selling will improve further to become competitive with other traders that are present in their place.

loans.use: to buy different grocery items like noodles, canned goods, soda, powdered juice, breads, and many more items.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma, who is 39 years old and a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. Her husband is Felix, a businessman.  She has one child. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gemma maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange.  A customer's order is paid for in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue; these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000.  She will be using the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gemma hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is married, with five children.   She is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Conchita has raised corn for a living for six years, and every month she earns PHP 5,600 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Conchita been a member of GDMPC since 2008. 

In the future, Conchita hopes to have her children complete their schooling.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is 50 years old and a hardworking and independent woman.   She lives in Punjab Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and two daughters. Her two daughters and one son are studying.  Her husband is an auto mechanic, but his income is too low to meet the basic expenses of his family. 

So since 2006 Sajida, by stitching clothes, has helped her husband to meet the household's and children's education expenses. And now she is interested in continuing to grow her business by purchasing a new tailoring machine and tailoring materials like thread and clothing.  For that, as a member of a four-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. 

She is very hopeful that the loan amount will bring out a positive change in their life.  Note: In the picture Sajida is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a new tailoring machine and some tailoring materials.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila, 37, is married with four children who are all currently studying: one in college, one in high school and two in grade school. She is working hard to get bigger income for their education. 

She has managed a general store for the past year. She invested PHP10,000 initial capital in the business. Luckily, she is earning PHP6,000 net income monthly in the store and her husband earns a salary from the construction site where he works.

To keep her business improving for her family's growing needs, Laila is requesting the amount of PHP10,000 to buy stock of merchandise to sell such as shampoo, conditioner, coffee, sugar, creamer, seasonings, breads, and many more.  

Her principle in life is, "Keep yourself patient at all times and you will reap a good fruit someday."

loans.use: to buy products such as shampoo, conditioner, coffee, sugar, creamer, seasonings, breads, and many more.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es: MARGARITO ES UN HOMBRE DE 50 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA SEPARADO Y VIVE SOLO CON SU HIJA QUE ACTUALMENTE ESTA ESTUDIANDO. EL TRABAJA COMO VIGILANTE EN UN AUDITORIO DE LA CIUDAD. Y APOYA A SU HIJA CON SUS ESTUDIOS. MARGARITO HA VISTO LA NECESIDAD DE REMODELAR EN SU CASA LAS PUERTAS Y VENTAS QUE TIENE, YA QUE CONSIDERA DE SUMA IMPORTANCIA MANTENER LA SEGURIDAD DE SU FAMILIA Y EL BIENESTAR DE SU HOGAR. POR ESTA RAZON EL SOLICITA UN PRESTAMO CON EL CUAL LLEVARA ACABO LA COMPRA DE LOS MATERIALES NECESARIOS PARA INSTALAR NUEVAS PUERTAS Y VENTANAS EN SU CASA.
texts.en:
Margarito is 50 years old. He is separated, and lives alone with his daughter, who is currently going to school. He works as a guard at an auditorium in the city, and helps his daughter with her studies. 

Margarito has seen the need to renovate his home by replacing doors and windows, as he considers it be of the highest importance that he maintain his family's safety, and the well-being of their household. 

For this reason, he is applying for a loan with which he will carry out the purchase of the necessary materials to install new doors and windows in his home.

loans.use: To replace doors and windows.

loans.name: Athman

texts.en:
Athman is a married man who has three sons and three daughters. He lives in Tiribe, a small town in the coastal region of Kenya. For the last three years, Athman has been operating a motorcycle taxi, serving the community. It is a business he loves though he narrates that it is a risky business--especially operating on dark alleys.

In addition to this business, Athman has a retail shop run by his wife. They work well together; they normally share ideas. Athman is requesting a loan in the amount of Ksh 10,000 to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. In addition to this, he will also purchase bales of maize and wheat flour, sugar, and rice for his shop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and bales of flour, sugar, and rice for his shop.

loans.name: Marve

texts.en:
Marve has been a simple farmer for eight years in Mallig, Isabela in the Philippines. He is 37, and is married with three children who are all school aged. 

He raises three fattening pigs and one pig for breeding purpose. He also manages a rice and corn farm of almost two hectares to financially support his family's daily living. From the livestock business, he is earning the average income of PHP12,000 in three-four months. 

Marve is now requesting his second loan amounting to PHP30,000 as added capital in his farming and livestock business. He will buy sacks of hog feed to sufficiently sustain his livestock. His hope is to continue improving his livestock business for the future college education of his children.   

Marve also operates a furniture shop business where he invested his first availed loan.

loans.use: to buy hog feed for livestock business maintenance.

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor is aged 23 years and married, with one son who is too young for school.  Sor lives in a thatched roof house in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia.  

To support the family, she has farmed rice and raised pigs and supplemented the family’s income by growing various kinds of vegetables for selling. The current business earns her about KHR 80,000 per day to meet family's needs.

Sor is new with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle, while the other member of her group has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she and her group member are asking for a loan of KHR 200,000 and KHR 500,000, respectively. 

As the leader, Sor will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business to gain more income, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married mother of four children who are attending a local primary school. She works every day to be able to fill the role of a mother for her family.

She opened a store in her house, selling cereals, which is located in a very populated neighborhood in the area. She is a very responsible person who wants to get ahead. She has a jovial and entrepreneurial spirit.  There is no doubt that she will meet all of the goals she has set for herself.

With the loan, she wants to buy more cereals, such as dry maize, beans, and rice.

loans.use: to buy more cereals, such as dry maize, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for 20 years. She earns additional income from selling vegetables and raising livestock. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор очень веселая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и имеет  3 детей. Детям 18, 22 и 28 лет. Ее муж работает преподавателем и получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Гулбахор  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 4800 сомони для покупки 2 теленка, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a very happy and cheerful woman. She is 50 years old, married, and has 3 children — 18, 22, and 28. Her husband is a teacher and receives a small salary, which is not enough to provide the family with all of the necessities if life. Gulbahor decided to help her husband for the family's benefit. With this in mind, she took a course called "Succeed" organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received her graduation certificate. She wants to start a business selling livestock, since she has experience in this type of business. She plans to use the income to provide her children with a quality education and food. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 4800 somons to buy two calves to start her businsess. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves for starting a new business

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахнозе 26 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Более 5 лет она работает учительницей в средней школе и получает маленькую зарплату. Она давно мечтала организовать свой бизнес, но не имела достаточного средства. С целью реализовать свою мечту она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  сухофруктов. Она планирует продавать свой товар на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки сухофруктов, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is 26 and married with one child. She's been working as a middle school teacher for over 5 years -- a job that does not pay well.
Shahnoza has wanted to start a business for a long time but didn't have the means to. To make her dream come true, she took the Business Woman Get Ahead class and received a certificate. Shahnoza wants to start a dried fruit trading business. She plans to sell dried fruit at a local market.
Shahnoza has requested a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy dried fruit to start her new business. She appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit to start a new business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 49 years old, married, and has 12 children. Among them, 11 were in school therefore Robert is working very hard in farming to support the necessities of his family. He manages a livestock business where he is consistently raising three fattening pigs for sale and one breeding hog for ten years now. Using his own money, Robert started the business. 

He is requesting now the amount of PHP15,000 to buy two pigs as replacements to his sold fattening pigs and to buy hog feed. His hope is that after four months he will have a bigger income in the business. To provide for their daily living and school allowances of the children, Robert and wife also buy and sell recycled materials. Coupled with hard work, patience and determination, Robert continues in reaching his dream and that is to provide complete education to his children for a better life.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and hog feed.

loans.name: Hasib

texts.en:
Hasib, 27 years old, lives in Kosovo. He is married and has three children, whose ages range from 3 months old to 5 years old. Hasib is currently employed as a security guard and also works in the traditional agricultural business of caring for and tending to sheep. Hasib has 30 sheep and he sells the lamb in the local market. Hasib is requesting a loan to pay for plastic pipes to set water in the stable for the sheep and to irrigate his vegetables. This loan will improve the conditions of both his stable and his vegetable production.

Hasib's goal is to increase his number of sheep in hopes of offering a better life to his family and to ensure quality education for his children. He very much appreciates this help!

loans.use: to buy plastic pipes to bring water into the stable and to irrigate his vegetables

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerissa is married and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a tricycle rentals business in the Philippines for 4 years. Nerissa has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase motor oil, gasoline, and other motor parts. In the future, she would like to save enough money to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase motor oil, gasoline and motor parts.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong resides in a rural village of the Kror Kor district of the Pursat province in Cambodia. She is 26 years old and married. She has one son, who is still too young for school. Rice farming on a four-hectare farmland is the main source of her family’s income, which she has been doing for two years. Kong’s husband also contributes some income by making palm juice to support the family. Together, they can earn around 20,000 KHR per day and save about 10,000 KHR each day after paying for their daily expenses.

Kong has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, while the other member is just in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her to better support her household expenses. Now, she is leading her group of two to request a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for laborers in plowing the field. She hopes to grow her rice quickly and healthfully so as to sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 46 years old and married, with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Grace runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Grace has been in this business for two years.  She sells a variety of items, such as soap, shampoo, sugar, and soft drinks. 

In the future, Grace would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo, Jr.

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Guillermo Jr. works hard to support he family.

He has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and he also earns additional income from rice retail.  Guillermo Jr. is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for his restaurant business.

Guillermo Jr. has been sustaining his business activities through his past nine loans from NWTF. He hopes that hard work will help him attain his dream of saving money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for his business

loans.name: Benungu

texts.en:
Benungu is from the town of Tiribe. He drives a motorcycle taxi. He is married with two children and has worked operating a motorcycle taxi for 3 years. He remarks that his job is very difficult because during the winter he has a lot of challenges since he has fewer passengers given the cold weather. His dream is to accumulate enough money to open a big retail shop.


He is asking for this loan to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi, since it is an essential part of his job. He is happy with opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo raises pigs, two for fattening and one for breeding. He is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to buy a sufficient supply of hog feed to maintain his business needs. The income from this piggery business is used by Eduardo for his family's necessities at home and his child's school allowances. 

Eduardo is now 51 years old. He is married and has a child who is now in college. Together with his family, he lives happily in a village in Mallig, Isabela.  His hope is to give his family a better living someday. His determination and faith in God pushes him to work in an extraordinary way to attain it.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 51, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines.  She is single and manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lolita operates a food stall.  In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than the raw food.  Lolita's regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Lolita is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lolita hopes that her nieces and nephews will finish their studies and dreams to have more customers that will patronize her food stall. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

Ingredients

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DURABANK, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Bertha tiene 41 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de lavado de autos, la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja en su negocio de lunes a domingo ,la socia se encarga de administrar su negocio el cual está abierto desde las 07:00am hasta las 06:00pm aproximadamente, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos de limpieza como silicona y detergentes .

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Communal Bank “Durabank” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 41 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three children. Bertha divides her time between her daily activities and her business of washing cars. She has been in this business for years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day. Bertha works at her business Monday through Sunday, which is open from 7:00 A.M. to approximately 6:00 P.M. She is a responsible and industrious person who works in order to help her family move forward.

Bertha is requesting a loan so that she can buy auto cleaning products, such as silicone and detergents. She is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy auto cleaning products, such as silicone and detergents.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
For ten years, from his piggery business Rodrigo has able to support his family's everyday living. He is a small farmer in Mallig, married and has five children -- two are married and living separately and three are still studying. 

Rodrigo requested the amount of PHP10,000 to be used as added capital in maintaining his piggery business.  With it he will buy an additional pig and hog feed.  The income being generated from said business will be utilized to pay the tuition fees for his children and to improve their general living condition. 

Rodrigo hopes to keep the growth of his business and he is dedicated to it for his beloved family.

loans.use: buy hog feed and a pig for fattening

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Yoeurn is a 53-year-old married mother of three children, two daughters and one son -- one of them is still in school while the other two have their own employment. Farming rice and raising pigs are the main sources of the family’s income, which Yoeurn and her husband have been in for thirty-one years to support the family. Their current business earns them about 14,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 6,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for their paddy field.

This is the second microloan for Yoeurn’s group with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The first loan has helped Yoerun to better support her household with  supplies and also expand her rice field. Now leading her group of two to apply for another loan with VisionFund for 2,000,000 KHR each, Yoeurn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor to plow the field. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully in order to sell it for a good price so as to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old.  She is married to a carpenter and lives in Isabela.  She has three children. 

For two years, Evelyn has owned a sari-sari store (mini store) located in front of her house. Evelyn believes that she needs to work hard and be patient in all aspects of life. She is asking a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy snack foods, drinks, spices and noodles for her mini store. She hopes that her store expands so that her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, 67 years old, is married and has ten children. She works hard to provide for her family.  Erlinda has been running a general store in the Philippines for 16 years. She also earns an income from buying and selling rice and ready-to-wear clothing. Erlinda has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Marianita has been in this business for 9 years. She also earns more income from raising livestock.

Marianita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mwahanje

texts.en:
Mwahanje is 48 years of age.   He lives with his wife and seven children in a neighborhood on the outskirts of Mombasa, Kenya. For the past 3 years he has worked selling vegetables and fruits from his home, where he has a small extension. He sells tomatoes, potatoes, onions, cabbages, kales, carrots and other products. His wife is also involved in food vending, selling dumplings.

Mwahanje has requested a loan of 30,000 KES, which he will use to buy more vegetables and fruits to supply his business and have higher sales. With this investment he will ensure availability of products to continue selling, as well as to cover his household expenses. In the future, Mwahanje would like to save to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: buy vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 40 years old and married with 4 children. With 2 children in school, Catherine works very hard to provide for them.

Catherine runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more products for her general store business.

Catherine has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, milk, soap, etc.  In the future, she would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Ardiane

texts.en:
Ardiane lives in the northern part of Kosovo. She is twenty-nine years old, married, and has two children, ages two and five years old. Her husband doesn’t work. Based on family tradition, she works in an agricultural business.
 
She has two milk cows, which she uses for her family's needs. She also sells milk products in her area. She typically can average ten liters per day, half of which is for distribution at 50 cents a liter. Ardiane is asking for a loan to buy another milk cow. This loan will help her to increase her income, doubling the amount she can sell from five to ten liters of milk per day.
 
Her goal is to expand her farm; thereby, giving her enough money to provide a better education for her children.
 
Ardiane would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Floripe

texts.en:
This is Floripe.  She previously received a PHP 8,000 loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were big for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Floripe dreams of expanding her business and helping her children finish their studies through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of ther work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies and merchandise products needed in her business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma, 53 years old, is married and has 6 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Gemma has run a general store in the Philippines for 20 years. She also earns an income from selling rice. Gemma has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell. Gemma has previously borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old and married with one child.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Arlene aspires to save enough for the renovation of her house and expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en: Jelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines for 6 years. She earns additional income from her general store. Jelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell. Jelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida, 57 years old, is married and has 7 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Leonida has run a general store in the Philippines for 6 years. She also earns an income from selling rice. Leonida has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Leonida has previously borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Ey's Group

texts.en:
Ey, 42, is a married mother of four children, one of whom is in school and still dependent on her. Her family lives in a rural area in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has been in rice farming on two hectares of farmland for twelve years to make a living. She can earn about 12,000 KHR per day and saves about 7,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. The main challenge for her is scarcity of fertilizer to support her rice paddy. 

Ey's group consists of four female members.  This is Ey’s first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, while the other members have been with VisionFund for two to three cycles.  Ey is now leading her group of four to ask for a loan.  She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and  pay for labor costs. She hopes her rice will become more productive and profitable so as to make her living better.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy, 50 years old, is widowed and has 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past 12 years, Lucy has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as noodles, eggs, sugar, shampoo, soft drinks, etc. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for her business. In the future Lucy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her business

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng, aged 51, lives in a wooden house located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married and has eight children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. The family's main sources of income for the last 30 years have been rice farming and palm juice production. They can earn about KHR 15,000 per day, of which they save about 10,000 KHR after daily expenses.
 
Heng has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles while Sinat is in her first cycle. The past loans have helped Heng to relieve her family’s burden and to improve their livelihood. She and her group member are now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Heng is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her rice more productively so as to sell it for a good price in order to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria is married with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Macaria is 46 years old and has one child who is in school.

Macaria has a desktop publishing and printing business in the Philippines. Macaria requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase some additional materials and equipment for her business.

Macaria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Macaria would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: To purchase some additional materials and equipment for her business

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita, 62, is a widow and has six adult-aged children. She lives with one of her children who is now married. To make an income everyday, she has managed a general store for the past six years. She earns PHP10,000 income from the business monthly. 


She is requesting the amount of PHP20,000 to buy additional retail product offering such as rice, fish sauce, and more stock of daily merchandise such as soda, bottled and canned goods. 


Warlita's proceed of income from business is planned to buy a pig and hog feed to have extra source of income and is intended for use in times of emergency.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, fish sauce and additional stocks like soda, bottled and canned goods.

loans.name: Nely Vicenta

texts.en:
Nely Vicenta is 38 years old and is married with 4 children.

Nely Vicenta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory.

Nely Vicenta has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Nely Vicenta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nenita has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia,62, is widowed with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, shampoo, soap, etc.

In the future Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory

loans.name: Richael

texts.en:
Richael is 31 years old and married with one child.

Richael works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Richael has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for two years and also earns an income from selling gasoline, rice, and charcoal.

Richael aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel, 35, has five children. He lives with his spouse and children in the town of Tiribe, Kenya. He has been operating a tailoring business for the last two months; he previously worked as a mason. He is very optimistic and hopes to earn a good income, because there is not much competition in his area. This is one of the reasons that he started this business. To improve his production, he’s asking for a 15,000 KES loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, lace, and other items to make garments. He will be able to increase his production and sales with this investment. His goal is to work hard so that his children will have a quality education and to have enough money to make some home improvements.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, lace, and other items to make garments

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi is 41 years old. She is very intent on lifting up her family from poor living.  She just finished her vocational course and she promised to herself that she will provide a better living to her family. There are many businesses in which she is engaged--one of these is a hog raising business. Through this she’s able to provide daily needs of her family.


She wants to improve and boost her income. This caused her to request a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs, as well as flour, sugar, and milk for her food vending business. She hopes to achieve her requested loan to further improve her businesses and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins as well as flour, sugar, and milk for her food vending business

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is 36 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their six children. Mupa has been selling fish for ten years, and it has been going well for her. This type of business is profitable because she sells every day.

Mupa has requested her third loan with Yehu for 40,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. This will allow her to continue offering better service and to have more customers. Mupa's goal is to provide better service in order to have a better income. She wants to be able to educate her children. Mupa has a good credit reference and she hopes to repay this loan, as she has done with the previous loans, so as to remain faithful and trustworthy for more loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad, 49 years old, is a good wife and mother. She has a hog fattening business as a source of income and to help her husband.  Natividad focuses on her business in order to earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and vitamins. Natividad hopes to earn a higher income this time for the financial security of her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy. 57 years old, is blessed with three grown children who already have their own families. She is now alone in life and needs to promote her own self.  Daisy engaged herself in selling bottles after she cleans them. She earns PHP 150 per day, which she usually uses to purchase her commodities. Daisy wants to improve her yields, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more bottles to sell. Despite the difficulty of this business, Daisy patiently works hard to soon achieve a greater income.

loans.use: to buy more bottles to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old. Narcisa is married and has 1 child. To make a living, Narcisa manufactures and sells hand-made baskets.  She has been doing this for 7 years and earns PHP 3,000 a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Narcisa joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 3500, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy materials to make baskets

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33 years old and married with 3 children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 11500 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rosemarie has been farming rice for 4 years and also earns additional income from rice and charcoal retail and fish vending.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has been engaged in a retail business for eight years. Despite her age, she successfully provides a good source of income through her diligence. She is aiming for a higher income that would make her living condition better. This motivated her to borrow a loan amount PHP 15,000 to buy bottles, plastics and aluminum to resell at a higher price. She wants to grow her primary business so that she will able to save for her future use.

loans.use: buy bottles, plastics and aluminum to resell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Salvacion works hard to support her family. She has a peanut business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of peanut to sell in her peanut business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy peanut to resell

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is 44 years old and married with one son who works for others for a fee. She lives in a rural area in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. To meet the family’s needs, Srey has been in raising ten pigs.   Her husband also complements their income by catching fish in the local area. Having been in this business for twelve years, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manage to save around 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

This is the first microloan for Srey’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her group member are asking for a loan in amount of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, Srey is going to use her portion to buy pig feed for her pig-raising business and materials to support her husband’s fishing business such as​ cast nets and fish traps, etc. She hopes to increase more income from her current business so as to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 50 years old.  She is a bottle dealer in her village. She buys bottles to clean up and sell to manufacturers of vinegar at their place. As of now, she is earning to help her husband support their family.   She usually earns an average of PHP 200 daily which she uses to buy food for them.

Francisca is requesting a loan amount PHP 10,000 to buy more bottles to clean and sell. She is hoping that her usual income would then be increased through the loan she had requested.

loans.use: buy bottles to sell

loans.name: Samaher

texts.en:
Samaher is a 29-year-old young woman.  She is divorced with no children.

For the past five years, Samaher has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries.  It has been a profitable project and the only source of income for her, but it is not enough to cover her costs.

Samaher is requesting a USD 1,000 youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request, such as rice, sugar and dairy products. This will offer to Samaher a variety collection of groceries to resell, which will increase sales and increase her income.

Samaher is photographed in her grocery store.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a general store business in the Philippines for 6 years. She earns additional income from raising chickens. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store. Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 52-year-old who engages herself in cleaning and selling bottles as a source of income.  The poor quality of life for her family led her to become more hard-working, so with her business she patiently buys bottles, cleans and sells them. She has been doing this for two years and is hoping to increase her income through asking for a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to buy additional bottles to clean and sell.  She hopes to earn more for the betterment of their lives and also to save for their future.

loans.use: buy recycled bottles to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, 43 years old, is from a village in Quezon. She is married and has three adult children. Gemma is a former domestic helper who worked abroad for many years. 

For the past 3 years, Gemma has managed a general store as an added source of income for her family. She is able to earn PHP 1,000 each week from this business. Gemma is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy fish, meat and vegetables as added product offerings, along with more grocery stock. Gemma will use the income generated from the business to support immediate members of her family and as savings for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat and vegetables as added product offerings, along with more grocery stock

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 40 years and single, with four kids. She has been in the hotel business for the past 12 years, earning about KES 8,000 monthly. This is her second loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loan. 


She borrowed KES 30,000, which she plans to use on purchasing maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, and rice for use in her cafeteria. 

With the anticipated profits, she plans to use it in repaying her loan and the remaining amount for running her business. She hopes to take care of her children’s needs and education.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 58 years old and married, with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store.

Alicia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, eggs, spices, bread, coffee, etc.

In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Flor Cristel

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer de 41 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Flor pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su madres, Flor puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, adicionalmente ella también trabaja como profesora de educación primaria en un pequeño colegio de su ciudad, Flor puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Flor se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: perfumes, cosméticos, shampo, cremas, maquillaje, entre otros; de esta manera Flor tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, así ella aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor is a woman of 41 years old, single, and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona. She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person. She has a great wish to excel. Thanks to her effort and her parents support, Flor was able to study the professional career of education. In her free time, she likes to walk in the warm and welcoming streets of her city. Sometimes, she cooks a delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca [Creole stew] to share with her family. 

With much effort, enthusiasm and thanks to the support of her mother, Flor launched her small business selling beauty products. Additionally, she also works as a school teacher in a small school in her city. Flor works about 10 hours a day and thinks she is doing well because of her dedication and for the kind treatment she gives to others.

Flor is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as perfumes, cosmetics, shampoo, creams, and makeup, among others. This way, Flor will have her business better stocked, so she will boost sales and increase her income. That will be very useful to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business, such as perfumes, cosmetics, shampoo, creams, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is from Malibangcao, Clarin. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Rosa has been cultivating corn for 10 years and earns 6,400 PHP a month from these activities. 

Rosa is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Rosa joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en: Amie, a 43-year-old married mother of seven children, five of whom are in school, has been buying and selling livestock in the Philippines for 30 years now, Having received 12  previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business,  Amie has requested a new one for PHP 29500 to buy additional livestock to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, a 29-year-old single woman, works hard to support her parents. She has a dry goods retail business in the Philippines, and also earns income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 44 years old and married with 8 children.

Belinda earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Belinda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Belinda is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité  Divino  Niño Jesus se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora de una de las miembros y gracias al trabajo de todas ya están en el tercer ciclo.
Antonia, una de estas mujeres, cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo y precio. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo ha podido salir adelante y por medio de esto ayudar a su familia. Su sueño es poder ir creciendo con su trabajo y el día de mañana tener una gran tienda.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de remeras, camisas, pantalones, etc. y con eso poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank Divino Niño Jesus (Divine Baby Jesus) was formed at the initiative of one of its members, and thanks to the work of everyone, they are now in their third loan cycle. Antonia, one of these women, relates that she sells clothing of all types and prices. She comments that thanks to her work, she has been able to advance and through this to help her family. Her dream is to be able to continue growing in her work and in the future to have a big store.

She is applying for the loan to purchase T-shirts, shirts, pants, etc., and with this to be able to continue working and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, shirts, pants, etc. to sell

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comite San Miguel  es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por 12 mujeres de esa ciudad, todas ellas amigas y vecinas que se esfuerzan por dar a sus familias todo lo que desean para un mejor porvenir.
Juana la presidenta vende comidas, y comenta que le va muy bien. Ella es una persona que se esfuerza siempre y trata de dar lo mejor de su para salir adelante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, pollo, verduras y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
The San Miguel committee is from the city of San Lorenzo. It is composed of 12 women from this city, all of whom are friends and neighbors who work hard to give their families all of what they desire to achieve a better future.

Juana, the president, sells food and she told us that it is going very well. She is a person who always works hard and who tries to do her best to get ahead.
