Los sueños de Alifonsa es algún día a través de su trabajo, poder tener su propia vivienda donde vivir con sus hijos y evitar el pago de alquiler.
texts.en:
Alifonsa has four children who all work. For her part, she is a saleswoman who sells clothes, artisan crafts, and other goods. She works every day, traveling to different towns and districts near her home. 

In order to improve her business, she is requesting a loan to invest in more merchandise and be able to strengthen the business. She will purchase blouses, children’s clothes, underwear, necklaces, earrings, and other products and goods. Through this loan she can improve her business and have the opportunity to grow more in the market. 

Alifonsa’s dream is to one day, through her hard work, purchase her own home where she can live with her children and not have to pay rent anymore.

loans.use: purchase blouses, children's clothes, and underwear

loans.name: Gloria Mary

texts.es:
Gloria, tiene 51 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tienen tres hijos de 22, 15 y 9 años de edad, también vive con ellos una nieta de dos años, Gloria se dedica a la producción de pollo de engorde, este negocio consiste en comprar los polloa pequeños tenerlos en una granja y proporcionarles todo lo necesario para su desarrollo, tiene más de 30 años en el negocio inicialmente produciendo gallinas indias, desde hace un año está trabajando con los pollos de engorde, uno de sus hijos, el mayor, es el que le ayuda a cuidar la granja.

Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pollos pequeños y también concentrado también comprara madera y láminas para reparar la galera, este crédito será un gran aporte para que gloria pueda mejorar las instalaciones de la granja y crecer en el número de aves.

Su aspiración es mejorar la vivienda, que sus hijos menores de edad continúen estudiando para que tengan mejores oportunidades de superación.
texts.en:
Gloria is 51 years old. She lives with her husband, with whom she has three children, 22, 15, and 9 years old. A two-year-old granddaughter also lives with them. Gloria has been raising chickens for more than 30 years. She started out raising gallinas indias, another kind of chicken, but started raising broilers a year ago. Her eldest son helps her take care of the farm.

She is requesting a loan to buy chicks and chicken feed. She will also buy wood to repair the chicken coop. This loan will be a great help to Gloria, allowing her to improve the farm's facilities and increase the number of birds she raises.

Her dream is to improve her home and to help her younger children continue their studies to that they'll have greater opportunities for success in life.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 32 years old. He is single. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation. Theogene was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both his family needs and his business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 30 years old. He is single. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation. Emmanuel was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both family needs and the business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs in the maize production.

loans.name: Mwangolo

texts.en:
Mwangolo is 45 years old, married, and has five dependent children. He lives in his own home in the town of Tiribe.

Mwangolo has a well-stocked grocery store. He has his own premises and his own home. He has been working in this business for approximately one year and so already has very good experience. He says that he has a well-established customer base which helps him to make very good income.

Mwangolo is requesting this loan to buy basic household products such as flour, detergents, soft drinks and other products that sell well. He is grateful to Yehu and Kiva for the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy basic household products such as flour, detergents, soft drinks and other products that sell well.

loans.name: Hiede

texts.en:
Hiede works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from fishing.

She requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. In the future, Hiede would like to save money to expand her business and make some house improvements.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 61 years old and married with 6 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Elisa is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hernanado

texts.es: Hernando de 46 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 10 a 18 años. Él desde hace 5 años tiene una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres y en general artículos de la canasta familiar; su principal clientela está ubicada en el sector donde tiene su domicilio y quienes le compran de contado y en pequeñas cantidades diarias, de acuerdo con los ingresos que reciben de sus familias; su experiencia data desde cuando fue ayudante en una tienda y poco a poco aprendió la administración de estos negocios.   El inicia sus tareas desde las 5 de la mañana y termina a las 10 de la noche cuando se va su último cliente. Las compras las realiza principalmente de contado en graneros y en la plaza del mercado, donde le ofrecen buenos precios; últimamente su clientela ha aumentado y sus inventarios rotan rápidamente, así es que muchos clientes llegan y se han terminado algunos de sus artículos, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará víveres como: arroz, aceite, azúcar, granos, carnes frías,  pues  surtiendo aumentarán sus ventas, y logrará poco a poco cumplir su meta de ampliar la infraestructura locativa del negocio, hasta extenderlo hacia la esquina de su casa, con tal de lograr  una mayor comodidad para él y un ambiente confortable a su clientela, en términos de conseguir su fidelización y poder ofrecer bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hernando is 46 and lives in the city of Barranquilla. He lives with his wife and three children who are between the ages of 10 and 18. For the past five years he has had a store where he sells food, groceries, and general goods from the family food basket. His main customer base is located in the area where he lives. They purchase small quantities from him daily using cash in accordance with the families’ income. 

His experience dates back to when he was an assistant in a store, and little by little he learned how to manage the business. He starts work at 5 a.m. and continues until 10 in the evening after the last customer leaves. He mainly makes his purchases in cash at the granaries and the market plaza where they give him good prices. 

Lately his clientele has increased, and his inventory has been turning over quickly. Many customers come and buy out many of his products, which is why he is turning to a Kiva loan. This is the first loan at the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will use the loan to purchase groceries such as rice, oil, sugar, cereal grains, and frozen meats. 

Being fully stocked will increase his sales, and little by little he can achieve his goal of expanding the infrastructure of the premises, extending it to the corner of his home. That would make it more convenient for him and more comfortable for his customers, helping him build customer loyalty. He also wants to ensure the well being of his children.

loans.use: purchase staples such as rice, oil, sugar, grains, and frozen meats

loans.name: Tat'yana

texts.ru:
Татьяна женщина - фермер. С 1994 года она  выращивает  кукурузу, дыню, пшеницу, чеснок.
Ей помогает муж и двое детей, 17-ти и 14-ти лет. Старший сын учится на автомеханика.
Развитие сельскохозяйственной деятельности начиналось на 25 сотках  с выращивания на продажу дыни и арбуза.
 Для вспашки и культивации этой площади, Татьяна решила приобрести мотоблок.
В планах на будущее: поставить теплицу  для выращивания ранних огурцов, помидоров и  пробурить скважину на своем участке, так как есть проблемы с водой для полива. 
В личных планах – завершить строительство  жилого дома.
texts.en:
Tat'yana is a female farmer. Since 1994 she has been growing corn, melons, wheat and garlic. She is helped on the farm by her husband and her 2 children, aged 17 and 14. Her older son is studying to become a mechanic.

Tat'yana started her agricultural business with 25 acres where she grew melons and watermelons for sale. To plow and cultivate 65 acres of land, Tat'yana decided to purchase a motorized farming equipment.

Tat'yana's plans for the future development of her business include setting up a greenhouse to grow cucumbers and tomatoes and to drill a well for irrigation. She also plans to complete the construction of a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase mechanized farming equipment to cultivate melons and watermelons.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo un negocio donde comercializa artículos de tecnología como celulares, accesorios para ellos, memorias, mercancía  en general y servicios de telecomunicaciones como llamadas y recargas a celulares;  su idea de negocio nació como una fuente de ingreso para el sostenimiento de la casa, su oferta la realiza   directamente en su puesto de trabajo, ubicado en su domicilio donde habita con sus   2 hijos en las edades de 20 a 37 años;  Los principales clientes son vecinos y usuarios del servicio de telecomunicaciones que pasan por su negocio hacen una llamada y continúan su camino; Consuelo en sus 7 años de experiencia comercial, ha recibido 4 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  que le han servido para organizar su negocio en la parte legal y administrativa y ha mejorado su estructuras y forma de atender a su clientela. Entre sus metas principales cuenta la de continuar el crecimiento de su negocio y para mas adelante tener su propio local y casa propia; porque su gran desafío  es que en condiciones  de mujer cabeza de familia, lograr cumplir con la totalidad de sus gastos, no es nada fácil, pero con su perseverancia y esfuerzo constante lo logra.
En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito e invertirá su primer credikiva, en la compra de planes de datos y de voz e internet y la comercialización de equipos de celular, accesorios y mercancía en general, su negocio con esta inversión mejorará con mayor cobertura de clientes, incrementando el capital de trabajo y eso es lo que ella justamente necesita lograr.
texts.en:
Consuelo has a business where she sells electronics such as cell phones, cell phone accessories, memory, and general merchandise, as well as telecommunication services such as phone calls and adding cell phone minutes. The idea for her business came out of the need to support her family. 

Her business is located directly in her home, where her two children, ages 20 and 37, live. Her main customers are neighbors and users of the telecommunications services. They come by her house, make a phone call, and continue on their way. Consuelo, in her 7 years of experience in this line of work, has had 4 loans with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. The loans have helped her organize the legal and administrative aspects of her business and improve the structure and the way she attends to customers. One of her main goals is to continue growing her business, and later on, have her own location and her own house. One of her biggest challenges is being a female head of the family. Making ends meet is not easy, but with perseverance and constant effort, she manages. 

Currently she is applying for a new loan that will be her first Kiva loan. She will invest it in data plans, voice plans, and internet, selling cell phone equipment, accessories and merchandise in general. The investment will allow her to do exactly what she needs to do, which is improve the business by improving coverage for customers and increasing working capital.

loans.use: purchase data, voice, and internet plans, as well as cell phone equipment and accessories

loans.name: Jocemie

texts.en:
Jocemie is 32 years old and married with 2 children.

Jocemie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like soft drinks, noodles and other groceries.

Jocemie has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jocemie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft drinks, noodles and other groceries

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and has 8 children. Elizabeth is married and 5 of her children are in school.

Elizabeth is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Elizabeth has been raising pigs for 7 years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 63 years old. He is married to a farmer and they both have four children. He has been a maize farmer for 40 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation. He was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilisers and support labor cost in the maize production

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is married with 7 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jesusa is 52 years old and 3 of her children are in school.

Jesusa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jesusa requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net, paint and other fishing equipment.

Jesusa has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough to repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, paint and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Joesela

texts.en:
Joesela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making and selling coconut vinegar in the Philippines.

Joesela requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more gallon containers for her coconut vinegar. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Joesela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gallon containers for her coconut vinegar

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 48 years old and widowed with four children. With two children in school, Lorna works very hard to provide for her family.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Lorna has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, bread, cooking oil and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, 64. She is a resident of Taguig, Philippines. Virginia is married to Cesar, a tricycle driver, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the businesses. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Virginia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Virginia hopes to have many loyal customers and dreams to have a good life with her family through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. Emma is widowed and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Emma requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell to customers.

Emma has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and married with two children. He has been operating a cafeteria business for the last four years, earning approximately 20,000 Kenyan shillings monthly. 

This is his second loan with KADET LTD. after successfully repaying his previous loan. He borrowed KES 10,000 and plans to use it on purchasing maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and rice for the cafeteria. 

With the anticipated profits, he plans to repay his loan and use the remaining amount for running his business. He hopes to take care of his family and build a better home.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
A married mother of seven children, 39-year-old Riza lives in Canibungan Daku, Clarin where she has been planting and harvesting coconut trees to sell for six years. Earning PHP 11,000 a month, Riza joined GDMPC in 2011 and is now requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

In the future, Riza hopes to expand and improve her business array to bring in good returns on subsequent productions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Twitezimbere /rhh Group

texts.fr:
Francine est le membre et la présidente du groupe Twitezimbere/ Rhh. Le nom du groupe signifie «Rêve toi et travailler».Elle a 36 ans et elle est mariée avec 6 enfants de 6 ans  à 17 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Elle a une personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Francine est menuisier. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des bois utiliser pour transforme en produit finis (des bois des charpentes). 
Pour accroitre son activité, elle planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de menuiserie. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait avoir son propre menuiserie. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Francine is both member and president of the Twitezimbere/ Rhh group. The group's name means "Dream and work." She is 36 years old and married with six children  between the ages of 6 and 17 years old. All of her children have received schooling. In addition to her children, there is one other person living in her care. She completed six years of primary school.

Francine is a carpenter. This is her first loan cycle with ACB. She will use the loan to buy wood for making her finished products (timber).

To grow her business, she plans to seek more loans to boost the capacity of her carpentry business. In the coming years, she would like to have her own carpentry shop. With the profits, she plans to pay for her children's education and medical care.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 58 years old and widowed. She has been a maize farmer for 16 years. 

Eugenie is requesting a loan, which she will use to support labor costs and to purchase fertilizer in order to increase her production. With the profits, she will invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire farm machinery that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. Therefore, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and support labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 58 years old and married with three children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as snack foods, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

Merlinda has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from e-loading.

Merlinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as snack foods, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Meredith

texts.es: Meredith tiene 50 años de edad, pero tiene una experiencia comercial de 4 años, la cual data desde que inicio su negocio de venta de productos cosméticos mediante guías especializadas, la cual fue en un principio  como un pasatiempo, y posteriormente la percibió como una buena fuente de ingresos y le dio una mayor importancia; hoy ofrece cosméticos, ropa interior, calzado, perfumería, mediante  catálogos y muestra directa de productos que tenga en existencia y que usualmente sus clientes compran; los artículos de catalogo los adquiere por orden de pedido y la demás mercancía en almacenes del centro de la ciudad, vende principalmente a crédito; cada quince días toma pedidos de su clientela, que en su mayoría   son mujeres que trabajan en empresas de la ciudad; Meredith ha recibido un préstamo de F.M.S.D, que le sirvió para ampliar el mercado, y ha visto con esta inversión su mejoría inmediata, porque hay mayor cubrimiento de la demanda. Su  meta es ampliarlo con mayor surtido disponible y a nivel familiar, sueña con adquirir casa propia; aunque  su mayor desafío es ahorrar lo suficiente para lograr sus propuestas. Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual  la comprará  cosméticos, ropa interior, damas y caballeros, perfumería, calzado, sábanas, pues son los productos mas solicitados por su clientela y lo hace en el marco de su  preventa; su inversión planea será exitosa  porque cubrirá la demanda, potencializando el incremento de sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Meredith is 50 years old, and she has four years of commercial experience.  This dates from when she started her business of selling cosmetic products through specialized catalogs.  She started this as a hobby, and later she noticed that it was a good source of income.  It then became more important to her.  

She now sells cosmetics, underwear, shoes, and perfume through catalogs and by showing samples of what she has.  Her customers usually buy items by catalog, which she gets by order.  She gets the rest of the merchandise from stores in the center of the city.  She primarily sells on credit.  She takes orders from her customers, who are mostly women who work for companies in the city, every two weeks.

Meredith has received a loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which served to amplify the market.  She has seen an immediate improvement with this investment.  This is because there is better coverage of the demand.

Her goal is to expand the business with greater stock on hand.  In regards to her family, she dreams of getting her own house.  Her greatest challenge is to save enough to achieve her proposals.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy cosmetics, women’s and men’s underwear, perfume, shoes, and sheets.  These are the products that are most requested by her clientele, and the purchases will be made during pre-sales.  The planned investment will be successful because it will cover the demand, which will enable the increase in her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, underwear for women and men, perfume, shoes, and sheets.

loans.name: Laura Lucia

texts.es:
Laura tiene 50 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, luchando mucho por sacarlos adelante. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores son personas muy alegres y sobre todo tiene un don para la preparación de platillos típicos, ya que son muy deliciosos, también la ciudad de chincha posee playas hermosas y también se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Laura es madre de 3 hijos de los cuales dos ya son mayores de edad y el ultimo tiene 16 años, quien se encuentra estudiando en la escuela secundaria, Laura es una madre muy trabajadora, sobre todo porque el padre de sus hijos la abandono y por ello se convirtió en madre y padre para sus hijos. Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta mucho  salir a pasear con sus hijos y en ocasiones preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual son los riquísimos “Tallarines Rojos”. 

Con mucho entusiasmo Laura trabaja como vendedora en una empresa de telefonía de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede  solventar  con mucho esfuerzo los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque le pone mucho empeño y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante con su familia.

Laura está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, fierros, entre otros; de esta manera ella podrá seguir construyendo su vivienda, ya que a raíz del terremoto del año 2007, perdió su vivienda, con lo cual seguirá trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y poder terminar de construir su vivienda para bien de su familia”.
texts.en:
Laura, 50, lives in the city of Chincha and fights hard to succeed. Her house is in Chincha, a city that is characterized by its warm and welcoming climate as well as being the birthplace of great Peruvian sporting glories. Also, its people are very happy and above all have a knack for preparing delicious traditional dishes. The city of Chincha has beautiful beaches and is developing agriculture and animal husbandry. 

Laura is the mother of three children, two of which are now adults and the third is 16 and studying in high school. Laura is a hard-working mother, especially since their father abandoned the children and she has taken over that role. When she has a little time off, she likes going out for walks with her children and sometimes prepares one of her favorite dishes - the delicious 'tallarines rojos' (red spaghetti).

Laura works enthusiastically as a saleswoman in a telephone company in her town. She works about 10 hours a day, and with a lot of effort she is able to meet her household expenses. Laura believes she is doing well in her business because she works hard, and is eager for her family to succeed. 

Laura is grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to the help she is receiving she is able to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement and iron bars, among others. With this loan, she can continue to build your home. As a result of the earthquake in 2007, Laura had lost her home and is still working towards rebuilding it and struggling to realize her biggest dream: "To provide a good education for her children and to finish building her house for her family."

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement and iron bars, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beans, sorghum, salt, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita, a 57-year-old married mother of seven, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a sari-sari store business in the Philippines for two years. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. In the future, Estelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
This is Eddie, age 19, who is a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. He is still single. Eddie and his parents manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eddie operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. He rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue to operate his business, he is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Eddie dreams of having a bigger computer shop. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and were he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in his business.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more items such as bread, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries for her general store business.

NWTF is relisting Ronalyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as bread, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Mashauri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Zainabo, leader du groupe d’affaire «Mashauri», est jeune entrepreneur, âgée d’environ 38 ans, mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse d’habits (friperies). Son mari est un petit commerçant de divers. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central Virunga. Il y a 9 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 13 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 2 ballons de friperies à marchander. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et agrandir son entreprise. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client Zainabo, leader of the business group "Mashauri," is a young entrepreneur, approximately 38 years old, mother to 10 children who are all studying. She is a seller of clothing (secondhand clothes). Her husband is a shopkeeper selling diverse items. She sets up her merchandise at the central market of Virunga. 

Nine years have passed that she has been practicing this little business which generates income. Meanwhile, she has just completed 13 loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan will serve to supply her with 2 bundles of secondhand clothes to resell. In addition, she hopes to see her children grow up comfortably and expand her business. The client thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy 2 bundles of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita is 50 years old and married with three children.

Susanita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery products to sell in her store.

Susanita has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Susanita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Msitamulivu

texts.en:
Msitamulivu is 23 years old and lives in the Kwale neighborhood of the Mombasa municipality. She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner Hamisi, who works as a businessman. Msitamulivu has a young daughter who is their source of joy for their marriage.


One month ago, she started a small store selling basic home products. She sells products such as rice, beans, sugar, flour, soap, and bread. She currently works everyday from 6 in the morning serving her customers.


She requested this loan of 15,000 KES to stock up her convenience store by purchasing stock of flour, rice, sugar, and other products. Her goal is to continue working and for her business to continue growing, so that she can continue supporting her husband.

loans.use: to purchase stock of flour, rice, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Elme

texts.en:
Elme is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elme is 55 years old, married, and has 4 children, one of whom is in school.

Elme has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Elme has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy parts for her motorcycle.

Elme has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Elme would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years.

Merlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and fishing nets.

In the future, Merlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and fishing nets.

loans.name: Juan Gilberto

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y dos hijos pequeños de 10 y 2 años de edad, dependen económicamente de él, Juan trabaja vendiendo cds y dvd, además de mercadería y artículos como carteras, los lociones, billeteras, papelería, llaveros, una gran variedad de productos es lo que ofrece a los clientes, dicho negocio lo heredó de sus padres y lo trabaja junto con su esposa.

Actualmente necesita realizar una compra de mercadería para fortalecer el negocio,realizando la solicitud de un préstamo que le permita cubrir el gasto y mejorar sus ventas, compra sería en CD y mercería de la que vende, ya que esto le permitirá incrementar su inventario y poder tener más variedad para atender a los clientes.

El sueño de Juan es comprar a futuro su propia casa, ya que actualmente vive alquilando desde hace 10 años, espera alcanzar una mejor solvencia económica que le permita adquirir la vivienda, con este préstamo espera realizar una buena inversión y que tenga efectos positivos de su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and two dependent young children, aged 10 and 2 years old. John has a business selling CDs and DVDs, as well as groceries, lotions, wallets, stationery, key chains, and a variety of other products. He inherited his business from his parents, and works with his wife.

Juan currently needs to purchase goods to help strengthen the business, and has applied for a loan that will cover this cost and improve sales. He will use the loan to purchase CDs and merchandise to sell, which will allow him to increase his inventory and be able to offer a greater variety to his customers.

John's dream is to buy his own home in the future, as he has been renting for 10 years. He hopes to achieve better economic solvency to enable him to invest in a house. With this loan he intends to make a good investment which will have positive effects on his business.

loans.use: to purchase CDs and merchandise.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, viendo la necesidad de poder comprar más materiales para el negocio, ya que estos préstamos constituyen para ella una fuerza de trabajo, pues le dan los recursos económicos para poderse comprar los materiales que intervienen en sus ventas, invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña, aceite, condimentos, que son necesarios para realizar las tortillas y al mismo tiempo realizar venta de pupusas.
Paulina está agradecida con el aporte de estos préstamos, ya que le han ayudado a mantenerse como un nivel de ingresos para solventar las diversas necesidades que se le presentan en el hogar, manifiesta estar trabajando de una manera más ordenada a través de los financiamientos kiva.
texts.en:
Paulina has decided to apply for a new loan as she sees the need to purchase more materials for her business. For her, these loans are her workforce, as they provide her with the resources to be able to buy the materials involved in sales. She will purchase corn, wood, oil and seasonings, which are necessary to make and sell hand made tortillas and 'pupusas' (stuffed tortillas).

Paulina is grateful for the support she has received, as the loans have helped her maintain a level of income needed to address the diverse household expenses. She says that she is now able to work in a more organized manner through the Kiva loans.

loans.use: to purchase corn, wood, oil and seasonings

loans.name: Gbossede Louise

texts.fr: Louise est âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants scolarisés dont le plus âgé a 05 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. Elle distribue des savons et vend des cartes de recharges depuis des années. Elle s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes dans l'un des marchés du bénin et de l'extérieur en vue de les revendre en détaille. Dans le but de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de maximiser son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Louise is 28 years old, married and mother to 2 children who go to school. The oldest is 5 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. She has been distributing soap and selling mobile phone recharge cards for years. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in one of the markets of Bénin and from outside the country in order to resell them retail. 

With the goal of strengthening her business and to satisfy the demand from her clients, she requested and obtained a loan from Finadev. This loan will allow her to maximize her supplemental income and to contribute to the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 cartons of soaps, 10 mobile phone recharge cards of 1,000 FCFA, 5 mobile phone recharge cards of 2,000 FCFA, and 40 mobile phone recharge cards of 500 FCFA.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ngenda, est conseillère du groupe d’affaire « Upendo », est  entrepreneur, mère de 7 jeunes enfants. Elle est vendeuse des oignons, aies, etc., et des boissons sucrées. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans toutes ces activités. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un petit dépôt dans le quartier Birere, au long de la route vers l’aéroport international de Goma. Elle a commencé cette activité avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il y a plus de 14 ans qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 18 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 1 sacs d’oignons et 2 sacs d’aies, etc. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et accroître son entreprise. La cliente salut l’initiative de l’IMF Hekima en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The borrower, Ngenda, is the representative of the Upendo business group. She is an entrepreneur and the mother of seven young children. 

Ngenda sells onions, garlic, sweet drinks etc.  She and her husband work together and help one another.

Ngenda displays her goods at a small market located in the Birere neighborhood, along the road that leads to Goma international airport.  She started her business using her own funds received from her husband, and she has now been involved in this type of income-generating activity for more than 14 years.

She has already completed 18 loan cycles using the micro-loan program offered by Hekima.  This new loan will be used to buy one bag of onions, two bags of garlic etc.

Ngenda wants to see her children grow up comfortably and she would also like to expand her business.

She thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of low-income women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy one bag of onions, two bags of garlic, etc..

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 31 years old, married to Melisa and blessed with a 7-month-old baby. Emmanuel owns rental houses, a business he started a year ago. He earns a monthly income of 90,000 KES. He has requested for a first loan of 50,000 KES to purchase building materials for a new project. The anticipated profit will help him buy more building materials to complete this project. 

Emmanuel dreams of expanding his business and becoming a prominent businessman in his town.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for rental houses.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Consolee is 58. She is married to a farmer and they have two children, ages between 15 and 20. Consolee has been a maize farmer for 40 years. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming, Consolee wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines, like tractors, that will enhance her farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation. Consolee was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is from Iraq. He is a youth client, married and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.

Haidar is a blacksmith. He has acquired this profession by working with his father for several years. After his father retired from his profession, Haidar took after him in 2010. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. Haidar is requesting $2,400 as a loan to pay the annual rent and to increase inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to increase inventory

loans.name: Kritono

texts.en:
Kritono is registered as a student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He takes the program Teknika. 

Kritono comes from a remote village on the outskirts of the strait Segara Anakan, precisely in Kampung Laut, Cilacap. This is a geographic marine area, pushing Kritono to become a professional tekniksi on a ship. 

His parents very much hoped to be able to help Kritono, but their income is only enough for their daily needs. His father only works as a farmer, as he has to support his eight children. Because of the financial condition of his family, Kritono is joining the student loan program of Kiva in order to help finance his studies and to ease the burden of his parents. 

He hopes to make happy the people who love him, especially his parents. Kritono is very grateful to Kiva investors from all over the world, because they can help him to achieve a better future.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is photographed in his grocery store. He is an 18-year-old single young man.

For the past three years, Mohammad has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him, but not enough to cover his costs. Mohammad is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar and milk, and to make improvements in the store's condition by installing additional shelves. This will increase sales and increase Mohammad's income to ensure a better future for him.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and install additional shelves

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 35-year-old, married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Although he never went to school, Christopher has a vision of educating his children up to the university. 

For 7 years he has been in the transport sector. He started as a hired driver and after accumulating enough wages, Christopher bought his own motorcycle. He faces hardships of high fuel and transportation costs. His vision is diversifying his business to include dairy farming and owning at least 6 motorcycles. Christopher needs a loan to buy a new motorcycle that he intends to hire out and earn 80% of the daily earnings.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: Honorine est une femme celibataire de 45ans mère de 02 enfants.Elle est commerçante dans un quatier de la capital où elle vend des plantains dans son domicile pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille dont elle en a la charge. Grace à son dynamisme et sa connaissance dans ce domaine, ses bonnes relations avec son voisinage, elle s'est faite une clientèle au fil du temps. Elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra donc d'augmenter son stock de marchandise (augmenter les régimes de plantains). Les benefices généres lui permettront d'investir une partie dans son activité commerciale et l'autre pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Honorine is a single, 45-year-old woman. She has 2 children. She is a retailer in a district of the capital where she sells plantains at her home to be able to take care of her family's needs. Thanks to her dynamism and her knowledge in this area, her good relationships with her neighbors, she has built up a customer base over time. She is requesting a loan which will allow her to increase her stock of merchandise. Part of the profits generated will enable her to reinvest in her business, and the rest will allow her to better meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of plantains

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is photographed in the construction workshop. Ahmad is a 51-year-old man. He is married and a father to three sons. He is a construction worker and earns a low income which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Ahmad wants to improve his work, so he is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new construction kit, which is necessary to provide better quality to his work. This will ensure Ahmad's better work and living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a new construction kit

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 30 years old married to Gladys and blessed with a 2-year-old child. 

He operates a retail shop, a business he started five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

He has requested a forth loan of KES 50,000 to purchase three sacks of sugar, four sacks of rice, five bundles of wheat flour and two boxes of soap. 

The anticipated profit will help him pay college fees for his wife. He dreams of buying a public service vehicle to venture and invest in the transport business for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of sugat, four sacks of rice, five bundles of wheat flour and two boxes of soap.

loans.name: Xavier

texts.en:
Xavier is 45 years old. He is married to a farmer and has four children. 

He has been a maize farmer for five years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation. Xavier was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both his family needs and his business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 59 years old, married to Anne and blessed with children over 18 years. 

He operates a retail shop, a business he started a year ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000.

He has requested a first loan of KES 18,000 to purchase a sack of sugar, two bundles of wheat flour and a box of bar soaps. 

The profit he makes will help him with capital to start poultry farming. He dreams of seeing his business grow to greater levels.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of sugar, two bundles of wheat flour and a box of bar soaps.

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en: Lynn is a 32-year-old, married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Lynn has requested a loan to buy shovels, chemicals, crops, etc.. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Lynn hopes to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: buy shovels, chemicals, crops, wheel barrow, etc. for her farm

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a widow, age 53. She has been a maize farmer for 20 years. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines, like tractors, that will enhance her farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation. Grace was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a 55-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Domingo, a farmer in the village who manages their farmland. The couple has five children. Felicidad wants a good future for her children. By engaging in business, she hopes to support the growing needs of her children. 

She started managing her general store 9 years ago. She wanted to earn income for her family, most especially for her children. At this moment, she is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP to purchase more grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, bread and soft drinks to sell. She will use the loan as additional capital to improve and expand her retail business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, bread and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 74 years old, married and together they are blessed with three children who are independent. Paul has been earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES from the quarrying business for the past 4 years. 

This will be his forth loan from KADET LTD of 70,000 KES, which he intends to use to purchase modernized equipment to ease the quarrying activities. He will use the anticipated profit to widen the market scope of the business. His future hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase modernized equipment to ease the quarrying activities.

loans.name: Tipesa

texts.en:
Tipesa  is 70 years old and married. She has five children. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks, drinks, flour, sugar, etc. She has been doing this for five years. 

Tipesa needs a loan to re-stock her shop. She hopes to use her profits to expand the front of her shop, for more parking space. She became a member of SPBD gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sugar, salt and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married and has four children. She is 28 years old and lives in Guingona, Ozamis City. 

Emily has been planting and harvesting coconut trees for eight years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2008, Emily joined GDMPC. In the future, Emily hopes to expand and improve her business array to bring in good returns on subsequent productions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Mwanakame

texts.en:
Mwanakame is a hairdresser who, through her work and sacrifice, has been able to get ahead and increase her income. She wants to continue her line of work and become an important small business owner. 

Mwanakame is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy shampoo, cream rinse, hair color, and restorative hair treatments.  These purchases will enable her to continue working and providing good customer service. Mwanakame hopes to open other outlets and hire employees in future even as she dreams of continuing to provide an education to her three children.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, cream rinse, hair color, and restorative hair treatments.

loans.name: Aïdote Group

texts.fr: AÏDOTE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même agglomération au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Virginie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Paul. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Virginie et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Virginie n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Il y a près de douze ans que Virginie mène comme activité la vente de divers produits vivriers (riz, huile végétale, galettes) à son domicile. Virginie exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Virginie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Virginie sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe AÏDOTE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Aïdote is a group of 3 people whose members lives in the same town in Benin. The group's representative, Virginie (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 42 years old and married to Paul. The couple have 3 dependent children, all of whom attend school. Virginie and her husband live together with their children and both take care of the various household expenses.

Virginie did not go to school. She has been selling various food products (rice, vegetable oil, biscuits) from her home for nearly 12 years. Virginie works with passion, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Virginie is requesting a 4th loan, together with the other members of the Aïdote group. This loan will be used to better respond to the demands of their clientèle and to earn more profits. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy various food products (rice, vegetable oil, biscuits).

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La socia , ahora tiene 51 años de edad, madre soltera con 3 hijos, vive en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia continua con su actividad comercial de compra y venta de alimento para ganado, principalmente con productos como pastos, forraje y alfalfa, pero ahora también se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes. La socia se ha mantenido trabajando en esta actividad la cual le ha permitido educar a sus hijos, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pastos  y cuyes, que le permitan capitalizar su comercio y segur trabajando, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su comercio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: The member is 51 years old.  She is a single mother with three children and lives in Urubamba province. She continues with her business of buying and selling animal feed and deals mainly in products such as grass, fodder, and alfalfa. But now she also breeds and sells small animals such as hens and guinea pigs.   The member continues working in this business, which has enabled her to raise her children.  She is requesting the loan to purchase grass and guinea pigs, which will allow her to finance her business and continue working.  For this reason, she is very grateful to Kiva for helping to develop her business and she is committed to making her payments on time.  The member belongs to the “San Jose de Urubamba” Communal Bank in Urubamba province, Cusco Peru.

loans.use: to purchase grass, fodder, and alfalfa.

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusufu is 50 years old and living in Masindi, Uganda. He is charged with a responsibility of looking after 11 children, four of whom are dependents.

Yusufu has been farming for 31 one years. He started by farming on his father's land and later bought his own. Like most farmers, he faces challenges of price fluctuations, inadequate capital and unpredictable seasonal weather, which limits his profits.

Yusufu’s dreams are to educate his children, build a permanent home and buy a motorcycle. His business goals are to diversify his business, expanding it into new markets and hiring employees to help expand the business.

Yusuf intends to use the loan to buy seeds and farming equipment like hoes.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming equipment like hoes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from the village of Cutog Grande. She is happily married to Domingo. The couple is thankful, because they have been blessed with five children. 

To earn living, Teresita is engaged in her hog-raising business, while her husband is busy managing their family farm land. They both work hard to meet their children's needs. 

She wants to have an additional hog to raise to increase her income. To make it possible, Teresita is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, vaccine and an additional hog to raise. She hopes to grow her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and an additional hog to raise

loans.name: Tasesa

texts.en: Tasesa is a 57-year-old woman who is married with 2 children. She has a small taxi service business. She has been in this business for three years. Tasesa needs a loan to buy more tires, filter oil, fluid oil, etc. She will use her profits to pay for her children's school fees. Tasesa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: tires fluid oil, filter oil

loans.name: Nuulua

texts.en: Nuulua is a 42-year-old, married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Nuulua has requested a loan to buy some chemicals, sprayers, crops, etc.. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Nuulua hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase chemicals, weed killer, shovels, crops, etc. for her farm

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en:
Fetu is 35 years old and married. She has three children. 

She makes and sells elei, traditional hand-stenciled fabric, to earn a living and has been doing this for three years. 

Fetu has requested a loan to by more equipment. She plans to use her profits to renew her kitchen. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paint brushes, a new sewing machine and thread.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Cambodia, Sorn is a 48-year-old mother of seven children. Two of her children are dependent on her and still in school. She has been involved in selling grocery items for five years and supplementing her income by selling pork meats. The current business earns her approximately 22,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Sorn has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for three cycles while the other member of her group is with VisionFund just this cycle. Sorn's past loans have helped her to build a new proper stall for supporting her grocery-selling business; all her loans have been repaid already. Now she and her group member are requesting a loan with VisionFund of 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, Sorn is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items to sell such as sugar, salt and eggs, and also plans to use a portion of it to buy more pork for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Maria Julieta

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de artesanías elaboradas a mano, ella vive con su esposo con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 31, 28, 24 y 15 años de edad, ella elabora el producto para la venta, comprando todos los materiales como las piedras, dijes, que son parte importante para que ella pueda elaborar los collares, pulseras, y salir a venderlos a las zonas cercanas de su residencia.

Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar ese material de bisutería,que son las piedras de diferentes colores y tamaños, hilos, alambres, dijes, entre otros materiales que son necesarios para que ella continúe trabajando, este préstamo le ayudará a brindarle todos los materiales y poder realizar su trabajo.

Dentro de sus objetivos está capacitarse en la elaboración de nuevos diseños de collares y pulseras, ya que esto le abrirá las puertas para ganarse nuevos clientes, espera de las ganancias del negocio poder contribuir a su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María sells handmade handicrafts.  She lives with her husband, with whom she has four children, ages 31, 28, 24, and 15.  

She makes the products that she sells, and she buys all of the materials like stones and pendants.  They are important materials to being able to make the necklaces and bracelets that she goes out to sell in the areas close to where she lives.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy jewelry materials like different colors and sizes of stones, thread, wire, and pendants, among other materials that are needed for her to continue working.  This loan will help provide her with all of the materials, and she will be able to do her work.

Among her objectives is being trained in making new necklace and bracelet designs.  This will open doors to winning over new customers.  With her earnings from the business she hopes to be able to contribute to her household and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stones, thread, wire, and pendants.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Rosalía, casada y madre de 1 niño en edad escolar, se dedica  a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite etc.  en su tienda de abarrotes.
Rosalía está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar su comercio y comprar arroz, azúcar y leche por mayor, por ello La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla en el fortalecimiento y crecimiento de su actividad y por permitirle procurarle una mejor educación a su hijo. Rosalía pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Rosalía is married and has one school age child.  Rosalía sells basic needs products like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and cooking oil, etc. at her grocery store.

Rosalía is requesting a loan to capitalize her business and to buy rice, sugar, and milk wholesale.  She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to strengthen and grow her business activity.  She is also grateful to Kiva for allowing her to get her child a better education.

Rosalía belongs to the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and milk wholesale.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is 31 years old and married to Martin. They are blessed with two children, aged 15 and 10 years. Phanice sells grocery goods at the main market, a business she started eight years ago. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

She has requested a first loan of 10,000 KES to purchase carrots and cabbages to sell. The profit from her business will help her educate her children. 

She hopes that in the near future she will be able to purchase a piece of land and build her own house, and thus live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase carrots and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna is 53 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Guingona, Ozamis City, Miraluna. She operates a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products, which she has been doing for eight years. She earns 7,000 PHP a month.

Miraluna recently joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps.

loans.name: Sicily

texts.en:
Sicily is 30 years old, single and blessed with one child who is four years old. She sells polythene bags in the area of Babadogo. Engaged in this business for the last two years, she earns an income of KES 5,260 per month.

Sicily is applying for her second loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD to buy more polythene bags to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business and support her child. She hopes to grow her enterprise and get established.

loans.use: to buy polythene bags to sell.

loans.name: Masela

texts.en:
Masela is 21 years old and married, with two children. 

She runs a small business selling snacks, soft drinks, pancakes, and buns in her community.  She has been doing this for five years. Masela has requested a loan to buy more stocks of ingredients. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Masela will help out with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: To buy snacks, soft drinks, flour, cooking, and yeast.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 37 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for 16 years. She will use the Kiva loan to cover labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently with the previous maize crop. She was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both her family and business. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs in maize production

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy invirtió su crédito anterior en dulces, productos por catálogo, telas para elaborar bolsas y con ello se aumentaron las ventas y las utilidades; Ahora está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva que invertirá en sandalias y bolsos para dama y dulces; ella es entusiasta y se siente segura que su inversión será exitosa,  porque hay gran demanda por parte de sus clientes con los cuales ha tenido experiencias  excelentes. “Gracias por el préstamo recibido, con él pude cumplir mis metas como comerciante al incrementar mis ingresos” este es un mensaje que ella desea enviar a sus financiadores de Kiva.
texts.en: Cindy invested her previous loan in candies, catalog products, and fabrics for making purses, and with it her sales and profits increased. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan that she will invest in sandals, purses for women, and candies. She is enthusiastic and feels certain that her investment will be successful, because there is a great demand on the part of her customers, with whom she has had excellent experience. "Thanks to the loan received, with it I was able to achieve my goals as a businesswoman to increase my income." This is a message that she wants to send to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in sandals, women's purses, and candies.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза очень целеустремленная девушка. Ей 23 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Фируза решила помочь родителям для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат.  Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  3000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Firuza is a very purposeful young woman. She is 23 years old. She is not married, and she lives with her parents. Firuza decided to help her parents for the good of the family. With this aim she attended the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received a certificate. 

Firuza wants to set up a business of sewing women's clothing, as she has experience in this type of business. She requests a loan of the amount of 3,000 somoni for the purchase of a sewing machine, in order to set up this new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for setting up a new business of sewing women's clothing

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Vy, a 27-year-old married mother of two, lives with her family in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To support the family, Vy has been farming rice for seven years on a one-hectare plot of farmland, growing pineapples; she supplements her income by making cakes to sell, while her husband is a construction worker in the local area. She and her husband are able to earn about 12,000KHR per day and save about 7,000KHR each day after daily expenses.

This is the first loan for Vy’s group with Kiva’s partner VisionFund; Vy is a group leader requesting a loan of 500,000 KHR, while her group colleague is seeking 1,000,000 KHR. Vy will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and materials such as flour and sugar for making cakes. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell her cakes for a good price so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 43 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 15 years. 

He will use a Kiva loan to pay labor costs and fertilizer during maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at a previous maize plantation. Celestin was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product; generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).
