Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertiliser and pay labor costs on his maize production.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en: Nicolas is 51 years old and married with five children. He lives with his family in the village where he generates income. Nicolas is engaged in a hog-raising business and has been doing this for four months. He usually earns about PHP 7,000 per hog he sells. Nicolas wants to purchase a piglet but he doesn't have enough capital. Nicolas is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and an additional hog to raise. He hopes to gain profitable sales in order to save for the educational expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy feed and a hog to raise.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 39 years old, married and is blessed with four school-age children.She has been earning a monthly income of KES. 5,000 from her medical clinic business for the past four years.

This will be his third loan with KADET LTD of KES.70,000, which she intends to use to buy more stocks of drugs such as antibiotics, syrup and vaccines.

She will use the anticipated profit to open another clinic. Her future hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and happy family.

loans.use: purchase more stocks of drugs such as antibiotics, syrup and vaccines.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 33 years old and has four children. He describes himself to be social and talkative . He operates a retail business where he sells decorations . He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located within a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy silicon materials for making rosaries to sell. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children with profits made. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy silicon materials for making rosaries to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 38 years old, married to Nelson and a mother of two children. She practices farming in Limuru and has been doing this for five years now.

This will be her third loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and seedlings. In the future she wants to raise her family's' standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is thankful for the support that Yehu and Kiva are giving her. She says that her previous loan was a big help because it allowed her to increase her stocks of flour, sugar and cooking oil. Jane is seeking a new loan for Ksh 80,000 KES to buy more items to sell to her customers, including maize and wheat flour, sugar, rice and snacks. Her goal for the future is to provide her child with a bright future through continuing education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Roman

texts.ru: Роман брал несколько кредитов ранее. Последний кредит помог ему увеличить доход.  Совсем недавно его дочка вышла замуж, родила ребенка. Роман сделал ремонт и также он помогает молодой семье его дочери.  Он просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 5000 гривен на закупку нового товара. Он хочет рассширить ассортимент продукции, чтобы привлечь больше покупателей.
texts.en:
Roman has taken several loans before. The previous loan helped him increase his income. Not long ago, his daughter married and gave birth to a child. Roman repaired the house and further helped his daughter's young family.

Roman requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 hryvnia for the purchase of new goods. He wants to broaden the assortment of products, in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of products offered

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 47 years old. He is married and has three children who all attend school. He has been a maize farmer for 25 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken at a previous maize farming harvest. Jean Claude was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both his family needs and business. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Buyantogtoh

texts.en:
Buyantogtoh is widow who lives with her three children in a ger in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her daughter Dariimaa is 22 years old and is disabled. Her son Otgonsaihan is 20 years old, and he works in private company.  The third child is a university student. 

Buyantogtoh makes a living by making clothes and fruit-farming. These businesses are now stable, and she has one employee. She is planning to expand the business by adding new work space and recruiting an additional employee. She is a hardworking and quiet-natured person with valuable experience in both of her businesses. 

She is requesting MNT 3,000,000 loan to buy fruit bushes with MNT 1,400,000 MNT and to pay her child's tuition fee with rest of the loan.

loans.use: To buy fruit bushes and to pay her child's tuition fee.

loans.name: Silvina Mila

texts.es:
Silvina tiene 57 años esta separada y tiene 2 hijas de 30 y 35 años.Ella desde muy joven le gusto el comercio y coser, cuando se separo de su esposo se dedico a confeccionar lonas y forros de camas.

En la actualida tiene su negocio de confeccion de lonas y foros. Hace su trabajo con la ayuda se una hija todo el dia, con el prestamo quiere comprar telas y una maquina de coser para mejorar la confeccion para sus clientes. Su sueño es tener mas contratos y adquirir mas maquinas de coser.
texts.en:
Silvina, 57, is separated and has two daughters who are 30 and 35 years old.   She’s liked to sew and being a merchant since she was very young.  When she separated from her husband she decided to go into making tarps and bedspreads.

She currently has her business making tarps and bedspreads.  She works all day with help from one of her daughters.  She wants to use the loan to buy fabric and a sewing machine to improve production for her customers.  Her dream is to have more contracts and to acquire more sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Orfilia Santos

texts.es: Orfilia, de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene 7 hijos, vive en el sector de Peña Blanca, Cortes. Ella se ha dedicado  a la agricultura desde muy joven, y hace 6 años ella hace sus propios cultivos de maíz y frijoles. La producción la vende en  el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra en la preparación del terreno donde va cultivar granos básicos de la temporada. Con esta inversión quiere sacar mejores cosechas y obtener los ingresos básicos para su familia. Su meta es apoyar a su familia a tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Orfilia, 35, is married and has seven children.  She lives in the Peña Blanca sector, Cortes.  She’s been working in agriculture since a very young age and has had her own corn and bean crops for the last six years.  She sells her products in the local market.  She’s requesting a 5,000 Lempira loan to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs to prepare the soil where she will plant seasonal basic grains.  She hopes to produce better harvest and earn higher family income thanks to this investment.  Her goal is to support her family and to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
Leonel tiene 26 años, es casado tiene un hijo y vive con su familia en el municipio de las Flores, Lempira.
Desde pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, y hace 10 años tiene su propia  finca de café. La producción la vende a los beneficios de café y a los intermediarios de la zona. Ha sido cliente de ODEF con cuatro ciclos con el actual préstamo que es por 8,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes para abonar bien la finca y lograr sacar mejor cosecha y calidad de producto. Su meta es mejorar la producción para obtener más ganancias y poder comprar otras tierras para ampliar la siembra de café.
texts.en: Leonel, 26, is married and has a son; he lives with his family in the municipality of Las Flores, Lempira.  He’s worked in agriculture since he was little and has had his own coffee plantation for the last ten years.  He sells his harvests to local coffee cooperatives and middlemen.  He’s been an ODEF client for four cycles and the current loan is for 8,000 Lempiras that he will use to buy fertilizer to fertilize the farm well and succeed in producing a better harvest of quality products.  His goal is to improve production to obtain higher profits and be able to buy more land to expand his coffee plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Zumratby

texts.ru: Зумратби 42 года. Она замужем, но не имеет детей.  Ее муж работает в Российской Федерации трудовым мигрантом.  Зумратби решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одеждой, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1600 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zumratby is 42 years old. She is married, but does not have children. Her husband works in the Russian Federation as a migrant worker. Zumratby decided to help her husband for the good of the family. With this aim she attended the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women, and received a certificate. Now she can start her own business and become successful in this area. 

Zumratby wants to set up a business of sewing women's clothing, as she has experience in this type of business. She requests a loan in the amount of 1,600 somoni for the purchase of a sewing machine, in order to set up the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for setting up a new business of sewing women's clothing

loans.name: Vyacheslav

texts.ru: Вячеслав торгует спортивными товарами и женской одеждой. Клиент трудолюбив, пунктуален, всегда во время выплачивает кредиты. У Вячеслава удачное раположение торговой точки для покупателей. Кредит понадобился для заупки осеннего товара - спортивных кюстюмов, спортивных штанов и курток, кофт, свитеров. Вячеслав надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить свои жилищные условия.
texts.en:
Vyacheslav sells sporting goods and women's clothing. This entrepreneur is hard working, punctual and always pays back his loan on time. Vyacheslav has a point of sales with a good location for customers. 

Vyacheslav needs a loan for the purchase of merchandise for the fall season - jogging suits, pants and jackets, cardigans and sweaters. He hopes to receive additional income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the fall season - jogging suits, pants and jackets, cardigans and sweaters

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 53 years old and married, with 13 children. She was not able to send them all to school for lack of money. Some of them got married at an early age, while others are attending high school. 

She is a vendor, while her spouse is a farmer. Now Erlinda is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to invest in additional merchandise to sell. She will buy cabbages, eggplant, fish, and eggs. She sells these items in a house-to-house basis. 

In the future, she hopes to construct a stable stall to stock up her merchandise and continuously offer good and friendly services to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, eggplant, fish, and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is from Annafatan. She lives with her spouse and four children. She is now 47 years old and manages a store to earn income. She sells grocery items to the people in her neighborhood. She is now asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy sardines, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell in her store. Margie hopes to acquire more sales and keep earning funds for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sardines, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell in her store

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent, 38 years old, has offered salon services for the past six years. She was married and is now separated. She is blessed with four school-going children. She earns an income of 13,000 KES per month.

She is applying for her second loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy more cosmetics for her salon. She will use the anticipated profit to purchase salon supplies and to improve her children's standard of living.

Millicent hopes to grow her business and to ensure that her family has a stable income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en: Petronila makes a living by selling vegetables in the town of Annafatan. She is married and has seven children. Despite facing many difficulties, her family is happy and grateful to have support from rice farming and vegetable selling. Petronila and her spouse are able to generate enough income to sustain her family, and she is seeking a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy cabbage, tomatoes and beans to sell to her customers. She hopes to keep her business profitable so that she can provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomatoes and beans to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en: Fatema is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Hasan appears in her Kiva profile photo next to a rickshaw. Fatema is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to Hasan and a mother to two sons. Fatema and her husband work in agriculture; they pick vegetables and transfer them to the market for sale. In order to facilitate this task, Fatema is requesting a 1,200 USD loan from FATEN to help her and her husband cover the cost of purchasing a new rickshaw. This will facilitate their task in transferring more vegetables to the market with less time and effort, which will increase sales and improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw for transporting vegetables to the market

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.es: Doña Angélica María de 37 años de edad, quien gracias a Dios  se mantiene en el negocio de elaboración de bordados  a  maquina en todo tipo de prendas de vestir pero en su  mayoría en blusas  para damas y niñas, doña Angélica viaja  cada ocho días a la entrega  de 100 a 150 unidades de blusas al mercado central del departamento de Chimaltenango, gracias a la demanda  que tiene en la elaboración de las blusas ella cuenta  con 5 personas que laboran para ella en su domicilio, es así como  doña Angélica logra cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes como a la vez provee de trabajo a estas personas  sintiéndose así una mujer  muy bendecida como  pequeña empresaria, Está solicitando este crédito para la compra de hilos, y de ropa típica como blusas y cortes productos que solicitan varias de las personas que la conocen y saben que ella viaja frecuentemente  a los mercados donde se adquieren las blusas y cortes de  mayor calidad, de esta manera ella aprovecha el viaje que realiza ya que lleva su producto y de  retorno trae mercadería para distribuir a sus clientas en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Angélica María, 37, thanks to God stays in business doing machine embroidery on all types of articles of clothing though mostly blouses for women and girls.  She delivers between 100 and 150 blouses weekly to the central market in Chimaltenango Department.  Thanks to the demand she has she has five employees working for her at home.  This is how Angélica is able to meet customer needs and she feels blessed as a small businesswoman to be able to provide employment for these people.

She’s requesting this loan to buy thread and traditional clothes like blouses and fabric that many people who know her request since they know that she travels frequently to markets where the better quality blouses and fabrics are available.  In this way she takes advantage of her trips since on the way back from delivering her products she can bring back items to sell to her customers at home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make traditional outfits and to buy traditional outfits to sell.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Máximo de 48 años, es un hombre trabajador, esta casado con la Sra. Albina de 48 años de edad  viven en su propia casa,  junto a sus 03 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos  sus esfuerzos. Máximo se dedica, al cultivo de café, cacao y piña. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Las cosechas de su producto los comercializan en su Distrito, ya que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los productos desde la cosecha hasta el punto de secado. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción. Este es su crédito número 07, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará sacos de abono orgánico, para la buena producción de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Máximo, 48, is a hard-working man. He is married to Albina, 48, and they live in their own home with their three beloved children, who are the main motive for all their efforts. Máximo works growing coffee, cacao, and pineapples. Every day, very early in the morning, he works with his crop, since he knows the money he gets for his products will depend heavily on the quality of his harvest. 

His harvests are sold in his district, since that is where people offer him the best prices. His favorite part of his job is harvesting his lands, since that is when he feels that the months of work have paid off. He has been doing this job for 15 years and thinks that the hardest part is taking the products from the harvest to the place where they are dried. In the future, he hopes to buy more land to increase his production. 

This is his seventh loan. He feels that the money from the loan will help him in the progress of his work. In his communal bank, he is well-liked by the rest of the members, because he is very supportive of them. With the 2,000 new soles, he will buy sacks of organic fertilizer for the good production of his crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат во второй раз берет кредит в нашей организации. Она хорошая и порядочная женщина. Саодат берет кредит для покупки зелени и овощей (капусты, болгарских перцев, баклажанов, помидоров, огурцов, тыквы). Она просит Вас помочь ей. Саодат планирует купить квартиру своему сыну.
texts.en: Saodat takes a loan from our organization for the second time. She is a good and respectable woman. Saodat takes a loan for the purchase of greens and vegetables (cabbage, bell peppers, eggplants, tomatoes, cucumbers and pumpkins). She asks you to help her. Saodat plans to purchase an apartment for her son.

loans.use: to purchase greens and vegetables for selling at the market

loans.name: Ravshanoy

texts.en: Ravshanoy is married, has five children and has always worked hard to earn money and provide a better life to her family. Ten years ago, she went into the business of animal husbandry, and is requesting a loan for $3,000 to increase the number of animals she has for sale. She hopes for the support of Kiva lenders because this loan will allow her to increase her income and improve her family's life.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to raise and sell.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en: Robinson is 30 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda, where he has earned a living as a farmer for the last four years. He started by farming on a small scale and after two good seasons bought more land to use for commercial farming. Like most farmers, his challenges include price fluctuations and seasonal changes in the weather. His dreams for the future are to educate his children, buy a car and go into the field of mechanized agriculture. Robinson is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings to plant.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings to plant on his farm.

loans.name: Jean Nepo

texts.en:
Jean Nepo is 48 years of age. His wife died recently, but she left four children with him. He has been a maize farmer for 17 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to purchase fertilizers during his maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. He wishes to invest the profits from his farming back into his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation. Jean was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both his family's needs and his business. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 42 years old. He is married, with five children, to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 20 years. He will use a Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken recently at a previous maize plantation near by.  Charles was very happy and excited that previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product; generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs Enhtsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her two sons, in a ger, in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her eldest son is a student. She got her drivers' license in 2008. In August 2012, she bought car and started a taxi service business. Before that time she was a server in a local cafe. Her working hours are from 8 am to 8 pm and her daily average income is 30.000 -35.000 MNT. She is a humble and hardworking woman. Today, Mrs. Enhtsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy gas for her car and to buy land.

loans.use: to buy gas for her car and to buy land.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 17 años; se dedica a la venta de carne, le gusta la facilidad con la que recibe los prestamos en FINCA  y tambien la posibilidad que tiene para ahorrar, gracias a eso hizo crecer su negocio, le gusta las capacitaciones por que aprende a mejorar en su negocio.
El prestamo que ahora solicita lo invertirá en comprar mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas has been a member of FINCA Peru for 17 years.  She has a business selling meat.  She likes the easy terms on the loans that she receives from FINCA,  and having the opportunity to save.  Thanks to this, she has made her business grow.  She enjoys the training sessions, because she learns how to improve her business.  

Felicitas is now requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to purchase pork

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, tiene 56 años de edad, vive con su esposa con la cual tienen tres hijos de 15, 8 y 1 años de edad, viven en casa propia, él se dedica a trabajar el cultivo de maíz con el que logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, este trabajo lo aprendió con su padre y tiene 25 años de estar realizando para su familia, su esposa le colabora en algunas actividades de la siembra.

Actualmente Jose inicia las labores de siembra de maíz, para esto solicita un préstamo porque necesita comprarse cuatro sacos de abono, ya que este material es muy necesario para poder fortalecer la siembra y aumentar la producción, el préstamo será una gran ayuda para que él pueda realizar su trabajo sin ningún atraso y con los materiales necesarios para poder garantizar la cosecha.
texts.en:
José, 56, lives with his wife and three children who are 15, 8 and 1 year old in their own house.  He works growing corn and is able to support his household this way.  He learned this occupation from his father and has been doing it for 25 years for his family.  His wife helps him with some of the planting chores.

José is about to start planting corn and is requesting a loan because he needs to buy four sacks of manure because this material is very necessary to strengthen the crops and increase production.  The loan will be of great help to him because he’ll be able to do his work with no delays and with the necessary supplies to guarantee a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of manure.

loans.name: Dúo Rositas De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
DÚO ROSITAS DE SAN MATEO
 En la comunidad de san mateo milpas altas, encontraremos a doña María Salome, de 54 años de edad se dedica  a la venta de comida todos los días frente al parque de San Mateo, ella  tuvo 10 hijos ahora 9 estan casados y 1 a su cargo su hijo tiene 12 años y el anhelo de ella es que  su hijo termine sus estudios ya que el próximo año comienza sus básicos ,doña María está  solicitando el crédito para invertir en su venta de comida, necesita comprar productos comestibles para la elaboracion de comidas normarmelte utiliza leña para cocinar y su espacio es pequeño, por lo que tambien parte del credito lo utilizará para comprar una estufa industrial, ella espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que ella necesita para salir adelante con su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
ROSITAS DE SAN MATEO DUO

María Salome, 54, is from the community of San Mateo Milpas Altas.  She sells food every day across from the San Mateo park.  She had 10 children nine of which are married and one, a 12-year-old son, is still in her care.  Her dream is that her youngest son completes his schooling since he’s about to start basic education next year.  

María is requesting this loan to invest in her food sales business.  She needs to buy ingredients to make the food.  She normally uses firewood to cook and her space is small so she will also use part of the loan to buy an industrial stove.  She hopes that she’ll be able to get this support she needs to get ahead with her business and family.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove and ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Gbessouvegni Brigitte's Group

texts.fr: Brigitte est la responsable d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Agée de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont un est déjà scolarisé. Le plus âgé a 5 ans et le moins âgé a 04 mois. Elle vend des céréales dans sa boutique depuis 06 ans puis s'approvisionne deux fois par semaine auprès des grossistes de la place. Dans la souci d'augmenter son capital et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu ensemble avec sa coéquipière un micro crédit à Fnadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Brigitte se trouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
Brigitte (on the left in the photo) is the leader for her group of two people who share a guaranty agreement. At age 34, she is married with two children, one of whom is already enrolled in school. The oldest is five years old and the youngest is four months old.

Brigitte has been selling grain in her shop for the past six years. She purchases her supplies twice a week from wholesalers in her area. Brigitte, together with her group mate, has sought and obtained a micro loan from Fnadev. With this loan, Brigitte hopes to increase her capital and meet the demand of her customers. Brigitte's goal is to maximize the income she earns, some of which she will use to further the education of her children.

loans.use: buy two sacks of corn, one sack of millet and one sack of beans for resale.

loans.name: Saroet's Group

texts.en:
Saroet is 33 years old and married. He lives in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He has two children, both of whom are dependent on him and still in school. The main sources of their income are from selling pork meat and raising chickens to support the family, which Saroet and his wife have been doing for five years. The current business earns them around 70,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Saroet has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for four cycles. He has wisely used the past loans to relieve his family’s burden and he has paid back the entire loans too. Now he and his group member are requesting a loan of 600,000 KHR and 1,400,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy chicken feed and use a part of it to buy more pork meat for resale. He hopes to increase the income from this business so as to improve his standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: buy chicken feed

loans.name: Kaiha Group

texts.en: Purunali is a 45-year-old married man with 6 children aged between 20 and 9 living in Kagadi, Uganda.Twelve years ago he decided to set up a retail shop in order to have a sustainable income for his family.  With the profits he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land.  He is also charged with the responsibilty of looking after two orphans.  Rurunali is hardworking and determined to change his future and that of his children positively.  Purunali needs the loan to buy soap, sugar and other general merchandise to sell.  He is a member of a group where each member guarantees for the others to access a loan.

loans.use: buy general merchandise to sell

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 62 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for 12 years.  Constance plans to use this Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer for maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

This photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation.  Constance was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both her family needs and her business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay labor cost for maize production

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 55 years old, married and has seven school-going children. She has been in the cereals business for the last one year, earning approximately KES 5,000 monthly.   This is her second loan with KADET LTD after successfully repaying her previous loan. 

Pauline has borrowed KES 40,000 and plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock of dry maize and beans for sale. With the anticipated profits she plans to plough it back into her retail shop. She hopes to open a supermarket in five years time.

loans.use: purchase maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 36 years old, married and has two children. To earn a living, he does pig farming. He has been in the business for one year. Through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management skills, he has improved his business.

Patrick hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en: Jacinta is 52 years old, married, and the mother of four children. For the past 16 years, she has earned KES 30,000 a month from her tailoring business. She is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD., for KES. 70,000, to buy fabrics and an electric sewing machine, which will make her work much easier. She will use the profits she expects to earn from this loan to make her business more stable and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Ludevina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ludevina works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying & selling rice. Ludevina is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Ludevina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Jose Adali

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, está acompañado, tiene tres hijos con su esposa de 9, 7 y 5 años de edad, él se dedica a la actividad agrícola desde hace 20 años, este trabajo lo aprendió con su padre cuando era pequeño y en la actualidad es el que le permite llevar el alimento diario a su familia y cubre las necesidades que le demandan, su horario de inicio de trabajo es a las seis de la mañana finalizando a las tres de la tarde.

José en esta ocasión solicita un préstamo para realizar la siembra de la temporada, para lo que necesitará abono y herbicidas, para iniciar con el maíz y frijol en la siembra, este préstamo ayudará para que el pueda comprar los insumos necesarios y fortalecer su producción garantizándose una mejor cosecha.
Su objetivo es tener una familia satisfecha con todas las necesidades primordiales cubiertas.
texts.en:
José works growing corn and beans.  He has a spouse and three children who are 9, 7 and 5 years of age.  He’s been working in agriculture for 20 years.  He learned this occupation from his father while still a little boy and it’s what now makes it possible for him to provide daily sustenance for his family and to meet any needs that come up. He starts work at six in the morning and finishes at three in the afternoon.

On this occasion, José is requesting a loan to start the season’s planting and needs manure and herbicide to start planting corn and beans.  This loan will help him buy the necessary supplies and strengthen his production guaranteeing a better crop yield.  His goal is to have a family whose basic needs are all met.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 39 years old. He is married and has five children. All of his children go to school. He has been a maize farmer for 11 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation. Paul was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business progress. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and to support labor costs in the maize production.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, salt, water, sodas, flour, margarine, cooking oil etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located within a busy town. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of household items. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more household items to resell. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will increase his business income.

loans.use: to buy household items to resell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 49 years old and is married with 2 children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Emily is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Emily has been farming sugarcane for 8 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a 31 year old married woman with four children living in Kasese,Uganda. She has been running a retail shop for five years. She started with 500,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings as working capital. Her hardships are inadequate capital to meet the high demand, price fluctuations, and inflation. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent home and her business goals are buying land to grow crops and expanding her business into new markets.  Oliver is requesting for money to buy sugar, salt, soap and bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap, and bread to sell.

loans.name: Beatric

texts.en:
Beatric is 39 years old, and lives in Buchanan. She is married, and has been educated through the 7th grade.  She has two children, ages 7 and 9, who live with her at home and attend school. 

For the past five years, she has been selling vegetables such as potatoes, eddoe (a taro-like tropical vegetable), yams, etc. in the local market. She enjoys her business because she has lot of customers, and the profit she generates helps her buy food for her family. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables (potatoes, eddoe, yams, etc) for her business, which she plans to expand.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables (potatoes, eddoe, yams, etc) to resell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 24-year-old married man.  He has 1 child. He describes himself to be a quiet and friendly man . He operates a motorcycle where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy town. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of fuel. 

Patrick will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to his saving to purchase another motorbike to increase his transportation services.  His business goal is to buy a taxi within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his child.  In addition, Patrick does farming which increases his business income.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Hak's Group

texts.en:
Hak, 47, lives in a rural village in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and has six children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school.  She earns a living through farming rice and planting oranges to complement the family’s income.  She has been involved in this business for twenty years and can earn about KHR 30,000 and save around KHR 10,000 after deducting daily expenses for future needs. Low crop yield is still the main challenge for her.

Hak received her first microloan from Kiva’s partner VisionFund one cycle ago, while the other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. With success and in a smart manner, she has used her previous loan to better support her current business progressively. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR 1,200,000 and KHR 1,400,000 respectively. Hak, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for cultivating her farmland. She hopes her crop yield will become more profitable so as she can obtain a better lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 42 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have four children. He has been a maize farmer for 20 years. 

Jackson will use his Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer for maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

This photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation.  Jackson was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both his family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay labor costs to grow maize

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a lady of forty-one years.  She is married to John and is a mother of two lovely children.  She sells vegetables and fruits and gets a monthly income of thirty five shillings.

This will be Irene's second loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.  In the future, she wants to expand her business further and also be able to support her family with basic needs.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 24 years old, married and has two children. Her spouse works abroad. Instead of lazing at home, she sells grocery items to her neighborhood and gains PHP 200 a day. She had been doing this for four years now.  

Fe would like to offer more merchandise, that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy grocery items (soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, noodles and sardines) to offer.  Someday she hopes to make her small store grow into a larger one so she can increase sales capacity and income for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en:
Venuste is 34 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 17 years. He will use this Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer for maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation.  Venuste was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both his family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: pay for fertilizer and labor cost to grow maize

loans.name: Cesar Enrique

texts.es:
CESAR ENRIQUE, tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, tiene 8 hijos, vive con la esposa e hijos  en  el Recinto Rancho Grande, del cantón Ventanas, provincia de Los Ríos.

La VRC  Bendición de Dios se   encuentra ubicada en el Recinto  Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche a  45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

CESAR ENRIQUE  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, urea, insecticidas, lìquidos mata plagas, ranger.  Con la ayuda del crédito podrá amejorarv la cosecha.
 
Las compras las realiza cada 15 días en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es comprar una finca para trabajar y obtener un poco más de ingresos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas que dañan los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar los cultivos.

"Cesar esta muy agradecido por el anterior crédito porque pudo sembrar y comprar los fertilizantes para que los cultivos esten en buenas condiciones."
texts.en:
Cesar Enrique, 54, is married and has 8 children.  He lives with his wife and children in Recinto Rancho Grande in Ventanas canton, in Los Rios province.

The communal bank "Bendición de Dios" is located in Recinto Rancho Grande in Puerto Pechiche parish, 45 minutes from the office of Cooperativa San Jose.  The group has 11 members.

Cesar Enrique is a farmer who cultivates rice and corn.  He is requesting a loan to buy manure, urea, insecticides, herbicides, and Ranger (a pesticide).  With the assistance of this loan, he will be able to have a better harvest.

Cesar Enrique makes his purchases every 15 days in the city of Ventanas.  His dream is to buy a farm to work, so that he could obtain more income.  The challenge he faces is dealing with the pests that damage his crops.

In his free time, he enjoys caring for his crops.

"Cesar is very grateful for the previous loan, because he was able to cultivate his crops and buy fertilizers so that he could keep them in good condition."

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, insecticides and herbicides

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 30 años, s un joven muy trabajador y sobre todo entusiasta, vive al lado de sus padres en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de maíz, plátano, algodón, entre otros. Luis trabaja desde muy joven ya que sus padres son personas humildes y siempre los apoya con los gastos de su hogar, debido a los pocos recursos económicos él solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica. Anteriormente Luis ha trabajado como operario de construcción, luego como vigilante en una empresa y actualmente trabaja como cocinero en una pollería de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 9 horas diarias; el cree que le está yendo bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo porque le gusta mucho cocinar y tiene buena sazón.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar los trámites para obtener su licencia de conducir, ya que se le ha presentado la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad y es importante que tenga dicha licencia, de esta manera el podrá tener un mejor empleo y poder seguir apoyando a sus padres y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un restaurante propio y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Luis, 30, is a hardworking, enthusiastic young man living with his parents in the city of Imperial, a city noted for having a very hot, welcoming climate.  Agriculture is common here too, especially corn, bananas and cotton, among others.  

Luis has worked since he was very young because his parents are humble people and he always helps them with household expenses.  Because of their limited financial resources he was only able to attend secondary school but would have liked to have studied mechanical engineering.  Luis used to work as a construction worker and then as a watchman at a firm and currently works as a cook in a roasted chicken shop in his city.  He works about nine hours daily.  He believes that he’s doing well in his work because he’s responsible and above all because he likes to cook and he prepares tasty dishes.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to pay fees to get a driver’s license since he’s gotten the opportunity of working for a transportation firm in the city and it’s important to have a license.  In this way, he will be able to have better employment and continue supporting his parents while he continue working hard to make his greatest dream a reality: to own a restaurant and provide his parents with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay his driver's license fees.

loans.name: Flabianus

texts.en:
Flabianus is a student of the Academy of Maritime Nusantara, he takes the program in accordance with the department of Nautical science in high school. He is the first of six children. His father works as an assistant teacher at a private school. The pay received is very minimal, for everyday needs that sometimes lacking. However, all parents want their children to get a good education for their future. 

Flabianus, as the first child, is expected to complete his studies for all. Due to family circumstances and the expectations of his parents, Flabianus applied for loans from Kiva to help him pay for his studies. Flabianus hopes to quickly complete his studies and quickly get the job he aspires to: reliable work as a captain.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de cereales, le gusta las facilidades que le brinda Finca para poder obtener los prestamos, gracias a ello logró construir su casa, también le gusta las capacitaciones porque le enseñan como educar a sus hijos.
El prestamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la compra de cereales para que pueda venderlo en su negocio y también para que pueda enviarlo a Lima.
texts.en:
Rita is married and has 4 children.  She has a business selling cereals.  She likes the easy payment terms that FINCA provides that enable her to take loans.  Thanks to this, she has managed to build her house.  She also enjoys the training sessions because they teach her how to educate her children.

She will invest the loan she is currently requesting in the purchase of cereals, so that she can sell them in her business and also send them to Lima.

loans.use: to buy cereals at wholesale

loans.name: Athanase

texts.en:
Athanase is 47, and he is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 20 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production; fertilizer will increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines, like tractors, that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken recently at  a previous maize farming plantation; he was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both the family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Frendi

texts.en:
Due to the background of his father, who he is a fisherman living with Frendi on the islands, which are connected by small boats, Frendi is currently studying commerce program management and harbor cruise on a sailing maritime school called the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. 

Because his father is a fisherman, Frendi is having difficulty in continuing his studies. The income of his parents is enough for their daily needs. Frendi's parents have been making every effort to help him realize his goals. Frendi is very grateful for the program's student loan from Kiva, because the difficulty in continuing his studies can be resolved. He will be more spirited again and diligent in learning, in order to quickly complete his studies. 

He wants to be a professional employee in a shipping company. He is eager to fulfill his dream of helping his parents and siblings to be more advanced and prosperous. Frendi is very grateful to the lenders, who are helping him to overcome financial difficulties.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita se dedica a vender carne y ropa en las ferias de Ccatun Pampa, le gusta las facilidades que le brinda Finca, también le gusta pasar un rato agradable con sus compañeras y también ahorrar en su Banco Comunal, también le sirve muchísimo las capacitaciones que recibe porque le ayudan a prevenir muchas cosas.
El prestamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en traer ropa de Lima para que la pueda vender en la feria.
texts.en: Margarita sells meat and clothes in street markets in Ccatun Pampa.  She likes the loan terms Finca provides and also enjoys spending pleasant time with her fellow members and to save in her communal bank.  She also gets much use out of the training sessions because they help her prevent many things.  She will use the loan she’s requesting to bring clothes from Lima to sell in the street market.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Mirtha Hungria

texts.es:
Mirtha empezó con su negocio desde hace 15 años con capital propio pues con este negocio pudo mantener a sus hijos ya que se separo de su esposo. 
En la actualida sus hijos son mayores de edad y son independientes. Ella tiene una tienda de viveres de primera necesidad.  Trabaja sola desde la 6: am hasta 10 pm atendiendo a los clientes. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el prestamo para comprar arroz, dulces, bebidas.  Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en: Mirtha started her business 15 years ago with her own capital and was able to support her children by means of this business since she separated from her husband.  Her children are currently all adults no longer dependent on her.  She has a grocery store and works from 6am until 10pm tending to customers.  She has many hopes for her store and this is why she’s requesting a loan to buy rice, candy and soft-drinks.  Her goal is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, candy and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Bonaventure

texts.en:
Bonaventure is 47 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 19 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production; he needs the fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The photo was taken recently at a different maize farming plantation. Bonaventure was very happy and excited that previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Oscar Ignacio

texts.es:
El joven Oscar es originario de Nuevo Laredo, tiene diez años trabajando como maestro de ingles en una escuela primaria. Oscar vive solo desde hace cinco años a decidido ser independiente y podo comprar una vivienda a la cual le esta haciendo falta la impermeabilización, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora.
Solicita el préstamo y así poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de impermeabilizar el techo de su casa.
Desea proteger y mejorar su patrimonio, ya  que en temporada de lluvia sus muebles se maltratan.
texts.en: Oscar was born in Nuevo Laredo. He has been teaching English in an elementary school for ten years and has been living on his own for five years. He was able to buy a house that needs waterproofing, but he lacks the money to do the improvement. He is applying for a loan to pay a worker to waterproof the roof of his house. He wants to protect and improve his asset since the rainy season would ruin his furniture.

loans.use: to waterproof the roof of his house.

loans.name: Nget's Group

texts.en:
Aged 40, Nget is married and lives with her husband in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has seven children, three of whom are schoolchildren. 

Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income.  She and her husband have been rice farming for ten years. Low crop yield resulting from flooding is the main challenge for the paddy-field.

Nget’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for one cycle. She wisely used the first loan to better support her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to request a new loan. Nget will use her portion to repair her old motorbike (a means of transportation for her business), and will use a portion on her children's education. She expects to fix her motorbike soon, so she can keep supporting her business on time, and maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to repair her old motorbike for business use, and for her children's education.

loans.name: Merriam

texts.en:
Merriam 45 years old, married, and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Merriam has a food business in the Philippines. Merriam requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy bananas and ingredients for her food business.

Merriam has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Merriam would like to save enough to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Zoila Idalia

texts.es:
ZOILA IDALIA, de 58 años de edad,  vive en unión  libre,  tiene 5 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Recinto Rancho Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas.

La VRC  Bendición de Dios se   encuentra ubicada en el Recinto  Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche a  45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

ZOILA IDALIA  se dedica a la agricultura, cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandúl, además se dedica a ala crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, ranger, insecticidas, líquidos para la maleza y monte.

 Las compras y las ventas lo hacen en Ventanas cada semana. El sueño es compra una casa con dormitorios grandes y que tenga un patio con flores. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan  son las plagas que se presentan en los cultivos cómo el cogollero y el ratón.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Zoila Idalia, 58, lives in a common law relationship and has five children.  She lives with her husband and children in Recinto Rancho Grande that belongs to Ventanas Canton.  The “Bendición de Dios” (God’s Blessing) communal bank is located in Recinto Rancho Grande in Puerto Pechinche Parish about 45 minutes from the office; it has 11 members.

Zoila Idalia works in agriculture; she grows corn, rice, pigeon peas and also raises chickens and pigs.  She’s requesting the loan to buy urea, Ranger [brand of herbicide], insecticide and weed killers.  She makes her purchases and her sales weekly in Ventanas.  Her dream is to buy a house with large bedrooms and a flower-filled patio.  The challenge she faces is infestations like ‘cogollero’ [moth larva that attacks corn] and ‘el ratón’ that attack the crops.  In her free time she enjoys doing domestic chores.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Meti

texts.en:
Meti is married and has two children. He loves his family very much. He is 27 years old and lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and children. 

Meti is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the city of Fuzuli. Meti tries all the time to improve his monthly income in order to support his family. 

Now he needs 1,800 AZN to buy tools for his work to improve his business. Meti has been manufacturing iron doors and grilles for windows for 3 years.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work.

loans.name: Derjmaa

texts.en:
Ms. Derjmaa is 54 years old and lives with her daughter in a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her daughter, Munhgerel, works as a nurse at a polyclinic. 

Last year, she bought a hectare of ground for horticulture and she planted organic potatoes, vegetables, and 300 organic sea-buckthorn trees. She is going to build a fence to protect her organic vegetables. She will sell the produce through her own mini-shop. 

She is requesting 3,000,000 Tugrik (MNT) to buy flat sticks for making a fence and for the cost of the harvest. She said with a smile: "If person wants to live nicely, they should enjoy labor". She is a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: To buy flat sticks for a making fence for and for the cost of harvest

loans.name: Elias Ramon

texts.es:
ELIAS RAMON, de 32 años de edad,  es soltero,   vive con el hermano, en el Recinto Rancho Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, no tiene hijos.

La VRC  Bendición de Dios se   encuentra ubicada en el Recinto  Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche a  45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

ELIAS RAMON se dedica a la agricultura,a la siembra de maíz, arroz además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y tiene un caballo. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, fertilizantes, abonos orgánicos, insumos, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos y mejorar los cultivos.

Las compras y ventas las ejecuta en ventanas de cada semana. el sueño es comprar una finca. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan  son las plagas que se presentan en los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar y jugar pelota.

"Esta muy agradecido por el crédito anterior".
texts.en:
Elias Ramón, 32, is single living with his brother in Recinto Rancho Grande that is part of Ventanas Canton; he does not have any children.  

The “Bendición de Dios” (God’s Blessing) communal bank is located in Recinto Rancho Grande in Puerto Pechinche Parish located 45 minutes from the office; it has 11 members.

Elias Ramón works in agriculture growing corn and rice and also raises pigs; he owns a horse.  He’s requesting the loan to buy urea, fertilizer, organic manure, supplies and insecticide.  With help from this loan he will buy the manure and improve his crops.  

He does his purchases and sales weekly.  His dream is to buy a farm.  The challenge he faces is crop pests.  He enjoys working and playing ball in his free time.  He is very grateful for the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Oyuntungalag

texts.en:
Mrs Oyuntungalag is 33 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  Her husband, Buyandelger, is 33 years old and works in the cashmere and wool trade. Her daughter, Undrah, is 10 years old and is a secondary school student. Her son, Temuulen, is 3 years old and is in kindergarten. 

Mrs Oyuntungalag started a retail trade business on a rental counter in 2012. Her rent is 442 000 MNT monthly, and her revenue is 100 000 - 150 000 MNT a day. She is planning to expand and offer more goods for sale. She is a hardworking and responsible person, with experience in the retail trade. She is asking for 3 900 000 to purchase additional inventory for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her retail business.

loans.name: Etihad

texts.en: Etihad is a 39-year-old housewife; she is conservative, so her husband appears in the photo above, as she requested. Etihad's husband owns a mini market to support the family. Etihad wants to support her husband and applied for this loan so he can bring more goods and food products to the store. She hopes the loan will help him increase his profits and thus improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to bring more food products to the store.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo por medio de una integrante, quien  informo a sus vecinas acerca del crédito de comité de mujeres, de esa manera invitaron a vecinas y amigas de su comunidad a formar parte de ella. El comité actualmente se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa.
La Sra.  Rocio tiene 33 años, está casada con el Sr  Christian, juntos tienen 3 hijos.  La Sra Rocio es vendedora de  carteras, Champion, Medias, y todo tipo de cosas más, comenta que su marido la ayuda en lo que puede y ella también pone todo de sí, para aportar con los gastos d la casa y de esa forma hacer todo más ligero. Tiene metas personales de construir su negocio en su casa y así seguir creciendo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carteras, Champion, Medias, y otros, con lo cual tendrá mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee came together thanks to one of the members who informed her neighbors about the women’s committee loans.  In this way they invited neighbors and girlfriends from their community to become part of it.  The committee is currently in the program’s third cycle.

Rocío, 33, is married to Christian and they have three children.  Rocío sells purses, athletic shoes, socks and all sorts of things.  She comments that her husband helps her in any way he can and she also puts everything of herself into it in order to contribute towards household expenses and thus make everything a little easier.  Her personal goal is to establish her business at home and continue growing this way.

She requests the loan to buy purses, athletic shoes, socks and others in order to have more variety available to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy purses, athletic shoes, socks and others.

loans.name: Marlene Mercedes

texts.es:
MARLENE MERCEDES, de 34 años de estdao civil unión  libre,  tiene 3 hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos, en el Recinto Rancho Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas.

La VRC  Bendición de Dios se   encuentra ubicada en el Recinto  Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche a  45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

MARLENE MERCEDES   se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de maíz comprar fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas,lìquidos para combatir las plagas, ranger.

Las compras y las ventas lo hacen en Ventanas cada 15 días. El sueño es comprar una finca. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan  son las plagas que se presentan en los cultivos cómo la langosta y el cogollero.

En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a los animales.
"Marlene esta muy agradecida por anterior crédito que le ha servido de mucha ayuda."
texts.en:
Marlene Mercedes, 34, lives in a common-law relationship and has three children. She lives with her partner and children in Rancho Grande precinct in Ventanas canton. Bendición de Dios [God's Blessing] communal bank has 11 members and is located in Rancho Grande precinct in Puerto Pechiche parish, about 45 minutes from our office. 

Marlene Mercedes grows corn and rice and also raises chickens and pigs. She is applying for a loan to buy corn seed, fertilizer, urea, pesticides, and Ranger weed killer. She purchases supplies and sells her products in Ventanas every two weeks. She dreams of buying a farm. Her challenges are the locusts and fall armyworms that attack the crops. She likes to tend to her animals in her free time and says she is grateful for the previous loan, which helped her a lot.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, urea, pesticides, and Ranger weed killer.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres Emprendedoras II,  trabaja con la fundación desde el año 2009, en la actualidad son 22 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya en el 9º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Claudia es una de las miembros y también es la presidenta, ella cuenta que se dedica a la venta de joyas, comenta que empezó con la venta solo a conocidos, pero después fue creciendo y hoy en día ya tiene una gran clientela. Su meta es poder tener una joyería bien grande y de esa forma trabajar y dar a su familia lo que desean.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas, como ser cadenas, anillos, pulseras, etc.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Emprendedoras II' (Enterprising Women) Womens' Committee was founded in 2009 and currently has 22 happily-working women who apply great effort and show great care in their work. Together they are supporting each other in entering their 9th loan cycle within the programme. Claudia is one of their members and also their president. She says that she runs a business selling jewellery and she comments that she began by selling only to people that she knew, but her business later grew quickly and today she already has a solid base of customers. Her goal is to be able to establish a very large jewellers and subsequently be able to work to provide her family with whatever they want.
She is applying for this loan to buy jewellery pieces such as necklaces, rings and bracelets etc.

loans.use: To buy a range of jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Shaher appears in her Kiva profile photo. He was photographed in his store.

Aysha is a 26-year-old young woman who is married and a mother of one son. 
For the past two years, Aysha's husband has had a home products store, which has been a profitable project and has many loyal customers, which is the only source of income to the family but it needs more support to cover the costs. Aysha is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of home products for his store. This will allow him to offer a better selection for his customers to buy, which will improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of home products for sale

loans.name: Adem

texts.en:
Adem is 44 years old, married and has seven children between the ages of 9 and 24 years old. Three of his children are currently attending school. He works in a primary school as a maintenance worker, repairing and taking care of the doors and windows of the school. Adem is the only one who supports his family.

In order to have more income for his family, Adem also supplements his income by working a second job doing transportation. Recently, he purchased the truck for his transportation business with borrowed money. He transports different things depending on the needs of the clients. Mostly, he transports and delivers large household furniture and appliances for people to new homes or during moves. 
Adem request a loan to repay the cost of the truck for transportation business.

He hopes in the future to also be able to buy a cow in order to support the dairy needs of his family. His goal is to provide a better education for his children considering that education will lead to his children’s better future. 

He is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To repay the cost of the truck  for his transportation business

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad, who appears in the picture, is a 28-year-old young man. He is married and a father of two sons. He is a construction worker and runs an electronics store selling hair dryers, mixers, etc.

Muhammad is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve the living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer Muhammad and his family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To purchase new living room furniture

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is 37 years old, married to Reuben, and blessed with two children aged seven and two. She keeps poultry a business she started three years ago and earns a monthly income of 37,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She has requested a third loan of 80,000 KES to purchase more chicks for rearing and selling later at a profit. The profit from her business will help her repay her loan and invest some in the business. 

She hopes to be a renowned entrepreneur as well as educate her children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Rapheal

texts.en:
Rapheal used the previous loan to purchase a fridge and sugar. He is a 39-year-old man with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children to attain degrees.

He has been operating a retail shop for the last two years. After starting with capital of 1,000,000 shillings, his business is now worth 3,000,000 shillings as working capital. His major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock for his store. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas and to own a wholesale shop. 

Rapheal is requesting for a loan to buy posho (a cornmeal dish), cassava (yuca), sugar, sodas and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy posho, cassava, sugar, sodas and beer to resell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras, tiene 51 años de edad, es separada y tiene 5 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 10 años; se dedica a la administración de su Hospedaje, cuenta que Finca le ayudó a  implementar su hospedaje y que también le ayudó en la construcción de su casa, indica que le gusta las reuniones porque pasa un rato agradable con las socias. El préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la construcción de su casa y el mejoramiento de su negocio. El sueño de Isabel es mejorar e implementar su casa.
texts.en: Isabel, 51, is a member of Palmeras communal bank, is separated, and has five children. She has belonged to Finca Perú for 10 years. She manages her hotel and says that Finca Perú helped her furnish her hotel and build her house. She likes the group's meetings because she can spend time with the other members. She will use the loan to build her house and make improvements to her hotel. Her dream is to make improvements to and furnish her house.

loans.use: to make improvements to her business.

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Damas Unidas, se conformo con la iniciativa de una de las miembros. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con 12 integrantes, y dicen que pondrán todo de ellas para poder crecer como grupo.
